text: Great service from this group.  The lady on the phone helped me figure out a glitch that was saying my appliance that was purchased two weeks prior was out of warranty. Had to call GE and fix the error. Then they sent someone out in just a few days to find out why my washing machine part of my washer dryer combo was not working. The person named Shawn was super nice.  My husband offered to help move the appliance out from the wall, he had previous neck surgery. Shawn quickly said NO, you sit down I will move it out.  Thank goodness, I wouldn't want to hear about my husbands neck for the next week.  : )    He found the problem right away.  We had a washer in this cattery building before and only used cold water. We had a fire and built a new building. When the carpenter put the new lines in, my husband told him to only hook up cold water. Well that was the problem, these newfangled washers have sensors, and the sensor on the hot side said there was no water coming in at all.  Shawn stayed around until the washer ran through the full cycle to make sure that was the only problem. He didn't say we needed a relay, a new motor, a new anything.  All we needed was the lever switched on on the hot water line.    He was super nice, courteous and I would recommend this company for any appliance service you need...We will certainly put them in our speed dial!       Mitzi and David Guess, Stevenson Alabama.

The technician insisted on calling me "young lady" which I found very patronizing. After this last round they said we needed over $700 in more parts and I called back 30 minutes later after I spoke with my husband to confirm they could order them. I called back today 3 weeks later to check in and they claim they never got the call and they hadn't ordered them. Even if this was a human error someone should have contacted me to check in on my decision before 3 weeks had gone by and I had to check for myself. name: Blake Roberson
text:
This company did warranty repair on a window air conditioner unit for me. The GE unit broke down 1 month before the 1 year warranty expired. Doctor Appliance came out, took the unit, worked on it, and then returned it. It worked ok when they returned it. It was working when they left. This was in late summer, so I only used the air conditioning for a month. This spring I started it up and it isn't cooling! The repair only came with a 90 day guarantee. So, I called them. It is going to cost me $120 bucks just to get them to come look at it, even though their repair was likely not done correctly, (the unit most likely was not functioning during the 90 day warranty, it just wasn't being used in the winter months). Long story I know.
I'm also extremely ticked off with GE. I now have a $500 unit that will heat but not cool. None of our local HVAC people will even come look at it. They say a window unit is just a throw away. I don't have $500 to just throw away! CUSTOMER SERVICE IS DEAD, A THING OF THE PAST.

resp.text:
Blake,

I am sorry that you are dissatisfied with our service. I will advise you that your unit was actually warrantied by the manufacturer not us. The manufacturer provides a 90 day warranty on all repairs any company performs regardless to whom performs the repair. Our warranty is slightly different and had the unit not been covered by the manufacturer things perhaps could have been different or at least there could have been more wiggle room.

I completely understand that you may not have used the unit for cooling in the winter. Unfortunately the manufacturers have no way of knowing when a consumer starts to use their unit and it is not up to us to make that decision. We have a contract with them that dictates what we can and can not do. Every step of the process starting from the first visit up to the final repair are documented. In fact we require prior approval from them before we can even put a single part on a unit. The manufacturer will perform a cost to replacement analysis to determine if it is a repair that they deem is worth pursuing.

I strongly suggest you call them and ask them to take care of the issue. I see them offer concessions on warranties all of the time. Especially in a situation like this. I have no issues with being an advocate for you in this matter. Should the need arise, you can direct them to speak with me personally.

Given your distance from us, we would have to charge a service call if the manufacturer is unwilling to cover the repair. Alternatively, you could bring the unit to us which would greatly lower the service call rate and you would only be responsible for the diagnostic.

Please let me know if there is anything else I can do to help you in this regard. Should they choose to send us a work order we would be more than pleased to come and help you. We want you to be happy with your product.

Please feel free to call and talk with me about this During business hours should you feel that I have left out any pertinent information. My name is Jonathan.

Kind regards,

Jonathan

text: Jonathan was our technician and worked on our refrigerator on a previous request. He was professional and took great care in cleaning up after the repair. Although we live in Athens and there are a few service repair centers locally, I felt confident in Jonathon's service history and contacted him when our microwave went out.  He responded expeditiously, placed the order for us and we now have a working microwave. Shayna kept me apprised of the status and contacted me when there was an earlier opening. It was most definitely a pleasurable experience. I highly recommend Doctor Appliance for any of your  appliance repair needs from dispatch (Shayna) to the repair technician (Jonathan) -- they are proficient and professional. Be sure to ask for Jonathan!!

name: Daniel Bell
text: Excellent communication and customer service. The repair technician was on time, very knowledgeable, and able to promptly fix my refrigerator issue. I will definitely be using their services for any future appliance repair needs.

name: LeRoy Stricklin
text: Excellent technician Johnathon. Arrived on time completing his work very professionally. I recommend Doctor Appliance to resolve all your appliances repair needs

name: Bobby Clark
text: Great company! LG linear compressor failed after 15 months. Lg sent these guys for warranty replacement as the warranty has been extended to cover 5 years labor and 10 years on the compressor. Doctor Appliance showed up on time and the technician was very knowledgeable and fast. He got the compressor done in about a hour and 1/2. The call center was courteous and kept me in the loop the whole time. Took about a week from start to finish. Thanks Doctor Appliance for the great work  and LG for standing behind your products and making things right on a known failure!!!

name: Jody Radley
text: WOW!  Excellent customer service, the serviceman not only fixed my stove, but cleaned up everything around it. I appreciated the little extras they provided. I will be telling all my friends about Doctor Appliance. Great friendly service.

name: Richard Knight
text: Incredibly good service in performing warranty service on our 2 year old LG French door fridge.  It was a major compressor repair & he did in just under 2 hours.  Technician was very competent & experienced.  It took 3 business days from getting the work order from LG to completing repair.  The dispatcher is very customer satisfaction oriented & called us promptly to both schedule the repair & let us know the technician was on the way.   The technician was extremely knowledgeable & friendly.  This is a top of line appliance repair business.  Can’t get it enough stars.

name: William Healy
text: Outstanding service, I would definitely recommend Doctor Appliance. Kendal gave me a heads up call as to his arrival, explained everything, was swift and very experienced, was very neat and organized, would have him back again for any appliance repair.

name: Al Beightol
text:
Honest on time communication, coupled with expert on time service. I would be foolish to
even consider calling anyone else for appliance service
Thank you Dr Appliance

name: Bob & Roxy Birkmaier
text: Great customer service from Shana and Jonathan.  Both were courteous, professional and represented Doctor Appliance well.  Jonathan's experience was evident in his repair and explaining the process in layman's terms.

name: Irene Lynn
text: giving a shout out to Doctor Appliance for the great customer service we received when our LG refrigerator was having some issues with the black stainless steel peeling off ...Thank you so much for replacing the doors....

name: Nancy Moore
text: The gentleman who came here was professional and very helpful.  I will definitely call again if I need any repairs of my appliances.  Was a pleasure to deal with him and was told if I have any questions, to call and he would be glad to speak with me.

name: Emily Jackson
text: Great experience!  I appreciate the prompt communication with the office, the technician was knowledgeable, arrived timely, and completed work efficiently. Will definitely use again!

name: Tony Monks
text: Excellent service. Went the extra mile finding the problem after another two companies couldn't. Thanks!

name: Cheri Randall
text: Great technician. Highly recommend.

name: shana porter
text: From the first call we made to them starting with Shana to Jonathan  coming out and fixing our fridge and ordering our parts , very professional very nice. Would use them them again and would recommend them to anyone.

name: Amy Colvin
text: fGreat and friendly service.

name: Lillian Guffey
text: Kendal was very nice, efficient and able to answer all our questions.

name: James Clark
text: he did  a great job.would use again.

text: The Tech came on time and was friendly, professional and Skilled in his knowledge of the problem, the service was completed quickly. I am very pleased with how the service call was performed.

name: Cam Sumner
text: Very professional. Quickly repaired refrigerator with minimal interruption.

name: Michelle Ullman
text: They are all friendly and keep you informed. Jonathon was quick at deciphering the issue, and he even asked for a broom to clean up, awesome!!!

name: TJ Peck
text: Technician was incredibly friendly and helpful in resolving our dishwasher issue.

name: Jennifer Henderson
text: They are the best!   Very informative too!

name: Tyler Malone
text: Doctor Appliance has fantastic service! We've had a problematic refrigerator on which Jonathan has replaced a couple of parts or performed maintenance. I've been extremely pleased with his ability to explain the problem and the work he has performed. Including the background on why our particular refrigerator model had a history of problems. Very knowledgable and always very personable, too.

name: Adam Stapleton
text: The service technician did a great job and Doctor Appliance will be the only company we will use for all of our appliance needs!!

name: Jason Wimsett
text: Alsome job.He came in my refrigerator was making the noise I called about( crickets ). Right then knew the problem( low coolant ).He check everything to make sure and replace the compressor.Also ask him question about the appliances I have and was able to help me out .Thank you

name: Philip Bowles
text: Great. Kendall did great . In and out. Will use again. Recommend others do the same.

name: terry sanders
text: They came out to repair a drier and after pulling it away from the wall and “fixing it” they informed my wife that they couldn’t put the drier back against the wall because they would have to move the washer to hook the vent hose back up. He wasn’t allowed to touch the washer.  I travel on business so that left my wife with four kids at home with no drier after it was “fixed”.  He said the drier vent was supposed to be 4’, and didn’t offer to place the proper vent hose on which we would have paid for.  All the tech was worried about was leaving, and BTW the drier is still making the same noise he supposedly fixed.  No concern for the customer more concerned about finishing his route, you are just a number to this company you would be better off finding a another company than these guys.

resp.text:
Good afternoon Terry and thank your post. The manufacturer of your unit contacted us to take a look at the unit and diagnose the issue. The issue is your side wall on the right hand side is slightly pushed in causing the unit to chatter against the steam line internal to the unit. Your wife was shown the issue. This unit is under warranty and thus we did not charge you for any work performed. In addition we advised your spouse as to the installation related issues in your current set up. I understand your frustration being that you were not home and we wish we could have related it to you directly.

When asked, your wife said she could have you replace the venting. Due to this being a warranty claim, installation issues can not be covered by the manufacturer. Had your wife requested, we could have charged you separately and addressed your install problem. She did not request this and stated that you would take care of it.

We try our hardest to inform our customers as to what their appliance manufacturer will and will not cover and are truly sorry if any of it was lost in communication.  Should you like to discuss this matter further, I implore you to give us a call. Please ask to speak with me “Jonathan directly”

Thank you for your time and take care.

name: Steve Jenks
text: Great  work. Very professional.  Explained everything that was done. A+++++. Great job.

name: Brent Noll
text:
Liars and obviously under qualified. "Johnathon" or whatever his name is would rather make excuses as to why he can't fix something than to actually try to order a part he doesn't have. There are much better qualified repair companies out there.
Avoid this business at all cost, they will make you wish you had!

resp.text:
Mr. Noll, can you please call our offices as soon as possible to discuss this  matter. We are located in Winchester TN and I could not find any customers in our records listed under your name. I would very much like to find out which one of our technicians was in your home. It is very important to us to make things right. You can reach us at 931-313-9083.

Is there a chance you have our business confused with another establishment with a similar name? I personally would greatly appreciate it if you called us as soon as possible. You may also reach us directly via email at service@docappliance.com

To show you how important this is to us, we are willing to come out to your location with no service call charge and take a look at what "another company" could not fix. We are contracted with most of the Major appliance manufacturers and unless a part has been discontinued we typically get it shipped to us. We would love to gain you as a customer and restore your faith in this industry!

name: Krissa Barnum
text: We bought a used washer and dryer and called doctor appliance to come out and take a look at it. They were very polite and reassuring that my units work great .. Highly Recommended !!

name: Lisa Greenwood
text: Called and a man came out. My dryer was giving me trouble. After looking  it over the man said no problem, I believe I have this part in my van. With a short reasonable amount of time he had it up and running again. Thank you so much.

name: chris maye
text: THEY DID WHAT THEY SAID THEY WOULD DO AND WERE EASY TO TALK TO WITH MY PROBLEM

name: Pamela Gregory

text: Amazing service. Their techs make sure the customer understands everything that is going on and are highly knowlegable. The fast turnaround time is fantastic. Nobody wants to wait for days without a stove or fridge.

name: john bufe
text: Top notch!  Replaced my microwave door handle that was broken.  After many attempts of gluing the handle back together I finally decided to replace it.  I called several local parts repair companies and the quotes that I received were more than the microwave was probably worth.  I happened upon Doctor Appliance and gave them a call.  Best decision ever, they were knowledgeable, friendly and were able to order the part and mail it to me.  Once I received the part they were able to walk me through the installation. I would highly recommend!

name: Teresa Safer
text: Great service!

name: Keven Vegas
text: I called these guys out last September when my Freezer stopped cooling. Turns out it was the compressor. They looked up my information and were able to submit the work as a warranty repair even when I didnt buy it from them. It didnt cost me a penny. I am very happy with their work and will continue to use them for all of my appliance needs.

resp.text: Keven, thank you for your kind comments. We try our hardest to make every customers experience the best possible. We are grateful for your positive feedback.

name: Noah Sidel
text: We needed some help with a couple of broken knobs on our stove and Doctor Appliance stepped up and not only shipped us new knobs, but also walked us through the installation. Excellent service!

resp.text:
Noah,

Thank you for the positive review. We try each and every day to make every customers experience a special one.

name: Jonathan Leibovitch
text: Amazing service at an affordable rate. Call them and you will not be disappointed.

name: Lynn Williams
text: Very nice and efficient service!  Thank you

text: I am glad LG partnered me with Doctor Appliance for the repair of my refrigerator under warranty.  During our initial call (spoke with Shana), they had already given me a date for the repair but when the parts came early, they called me again to have the repair done earlier.  On repair day, Jonathan called to say he was on his way and was about 15 minutes away.  He did the repair and I had a working refrigerator after 1.5 hours!  Thank you!!

name: Samantha Quinn
text: Great company, really professional, washing machine works great.

name: Garvintncom Nashville
text: I know and trust them enough I send all of my clients to them

name: Michael Warren
text: Kendal was great

name: Diane Dowden
text: He was fast, and experienced

name: Cori Goddard
text: Horrible company. Absolutely no customer service. I called 4 days in a row, sent an email and Will not communicate with American Home Sheild. “Pearl Ann”was the only person I could speak to and she blamed the technician for not notating correctly and that she couldn’t help me, she was the rudest person I’ve ever spoke to in customer service. (They say it’s repairable but the technician said it caught fire and was unsafe). They need to not falsify documents and learn how to talk to customers. I understand this is a family business and you do what you want essentially but don’t hang up on someone when they ask for help. Took 3 months and still no resolution. Just like all the other negative comments, do not let your warranty company send them out!

name: Reino Fritz
text: Washing machine agitator went out and tech came out to fix it. In the progress he blew up the control board. Its been over a month and still waiting on then. They never call with updates. I have to call everytime to see what is going on with the case and they keep you on hold forever. Worst place.

name: Rachel Johnston
text: HORRIBLE !!! THE WORST! I have never taken the time to complain online about a company. That is how bad they are. I have been waiting on a warranty refrigerator repair for 6 weeks. They canceled the first appointment. Then closed my request. After 2 weeks of waiting on hold, emailing, putting a request on their website I finally was able to get a hold of someone. They rescheduled 2 weeks out!! The technician showed up but left because he said he didn't have a gate code. After waiting 6 weeks!! I still can not get ahold of anyone to get my refrigerator fixed. I have lost 2 full stock of food waiting on them. I've paid a repair man 3 time to temp defrost fridge waiting on repair. This is the worst experience I have ever had with a service company. They will never answer their phone. !!

name: Mary Carroll Finley
text: TERRIBLE! Truly the worst company. Our Kitchenaid refrigerator stopped cooling. With it still under warranty, we had to UNFORTUNATELY rely on S & S. They sent someone to tell us what we already knew...that it wasn't cooling and that parts had to be ordered. WEEKS later the part is "in" and we were scheduled to have repaired today. My husband even went by yesterday to confirm. We were told once again that the part was in and that they would be here this morning between 8AM-12PM. Guess what? The part is now MISSING! Our appointment is cancelled and part has to be ordered again. We are now almost 2 months without a refrigerator with no end in sight. No one there cares. Not their problem. They don't answer the phone either so don't even waste your time on that. Truly mind blowing.

name: Randy Buckner
text: I scheduled a service appointment on-line, through the Maytag Service center. I selected the first available date from the calendar provided. 10 days later on the scheduled and accepted date for the repair i was notified that they were overbooked and could not come out for another 10 days.  When I called Maytag they conformed that the appointment was accepted by S & S and a technician was assigned.  when I called S & S to discuss this the service agent got defensive and stated that there were many others who have been waiting for months for parts and that I had NO RIGHT to cut the line!!!!  After I asked to speak with someone above him he said that he would forward my info to management and HUNG UP on me! This is the worst service group I have ever seen!  I called MAYTAG back and found another Maytag service company to come and service my machine.

name: Darryl Lee
text: I scheduled this company to come look at my refrigerator at the advice of another company since they handled the warranty work for Kitchen Aid. My refrigerator stopped cooling and the freezer stopped working. I was unable to reach the company on the phone and did not get a callback from the message I left, so I scheduled an appointment online. This was on 11/30/20. Tech came out on 12/4/20 and determined that the compressor was bad and needed to be replaced. they had to order parts. After finally getting the parts, a different tech came out on 1/20/21. He said the compressor was working and some boards needed to be replaced. Again, parts had to be ordered. A while after the expected parts delivery date, I called for an update and was told the parts were in.  An appointment was scheduled for the following week on 3/1/21. On the morning of the appointment, the tech called me and said that the parts were not in and cancelled the appointment. At this point, I was livid and called Kitchen Aid directly to complain. They called S&S and basically were told that the parts were never ordered. So again, I had to wait for parts. On 4/2/21, I received an email that the parts were in and a link to schedule an appointment. I tried calling, but again, got no one and I left a message. I never received a call back. I tried again the following day, but still could not get anyone on the phone. I went ahead and scheduled an appointment for 4/15/21. On 4/15, my appointment was scheduled between 8-12. when it got to be almost 12, I called and actually got a person on the phone. They told me that they were overbooked and someone was supposed to call me and tell me that my appointment had been cancelled. I wanted to reach through the phone and rip someone's head off!!!!! They rescheduled me for today, 4/16/21. Tech came out and replaced the boards and said that the compressor was not coming on. Now I have to wait for a compressor to be ordered AGAIN!!!! I was given an appointment date of 4/26/21 and that's if the parts comes in, which I'm not counting on . By then it will have been almost five months that I've had to be without my refrigerator. This company seems to handle a lot of warranty work and if you have to use them, I hope this will let you know what you're getting into. If you don't have to use them.....RUN AWAY!!!!!!

name: Charli Hamlin
text: This was the second time we’ve used S & S for a kitchen appliance repair (last year was the dishwasher), and we’ve had wonderful experiences both times. Brandon was so kind, called ahead to work out a time to come, then called again closer to that time to confirm. He was super knowledgeable, neat, tidy, very pleasant and professional, and worked efficiently. We will always use S & S and request him as our technician again! Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for the review and the feedback Charli! Brandon is a great guy and a great tech and we'll be happy to send him back next time you need us (hopefully it's not too soon ☺)

name: James Scarbrough
text: I have called this company 3 days in a row now and they do not answer their phone nor will they call me back. I've listened to the on hold music now for over 3 hours this week. I've left messages and still no call back. I am supposed to have a technician come out today to repair my fridge today, 5/28/21. No one has called me or emailed me to confirm my appointment. So imagine they're not coming today and I'll have to wait another month for the the next appointment. It has been 4 months and my refrigerator, which is under warranty, has not been fixed! I will call Whirlpool and request a different service company. I would never recommend this company. Communication is key!

name: Greg Gouge
text: Fast, friendly service.  Technician was both professional and personable.  Recommended for all your appliance repairs.

name: Brandon Matthews
text:
S&S came to repair my fridge that was making a weird noise and not making ice properly. The tech asked some great questions on the phone to better prepare himself for when he arrived on site. He also called with a 30 minute heads up that he was on his way, which I greatly appreciated.

The tech was knowledgable, friendly, and went above and beyond for me. He was even going to put everything back into the freezer and fridge when he was done. I assured him that was more than necessary and I would take care of it.

The fridge ultimately has to be replaced, but the tech did all he could to leave it as good as possible so I can have more time to shop.

Overall I was pleased with my experience and will definately call S&S again in the future.

name: Katheleen Garanzuay
text: It was a bad experience the guy you sent out here didn't do anything but stand around and argued with me when I was trying to tell him what was wrong with the refrigerator he refused to look at it so I told him to leave and I contacted rentacenter and told them to find someone else I didn't appreciate his addittude very rude and very uninterested in the job at hand

name: Tina Hart
text:
Read everyone's reviews from the past two months from lack of communication and just not getting the job done. I had the exact same experience. I do not recommend and will never use. American home shield needs to outsource to another company.

UPDATE!!!
Instead of being sorry that I had a poor experience, do your job and fix my oven. : )

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback Ms. Hart. I'm sorry to hear that you felt your experience was not a good one. We did reach out multiple times to get you scheduled after getting the part in with no response, and when we did speak to you and come to your home, he replaced the malfunctioning part in your oven and confirmed it was working as it should.

name: Adam West
text: I cannot speak more highly of S&S Appliance. The team is always extremely professional, knowledgable, and strives to ensure their customers are happy. I understand that this is something which comes from the top and filters into their staff. These type of emergencies are not always a quick or even an easy fix but the team works hard to make sure the issue is fixed quickly. Things break, things stop working, and we appreciate how the team works to make sure those items that make our daily lives easier, working again.

resp.text: Thanks you the review and the feedback Adam! We know how frustrating it can be when an essential appliance in your house goes down and we always want to get the customer back up and going as quickly as possible. Glad we were able to get you taken care of and hope you'll think of us next time you're in need of a repair.

name: Keisha Torres
text:
Customer Beware:

This has been the most unprofessional and frustrating company that I have ever had to work with. We have had an open job with them for over a month and still cannot get a technician to come fix our washing machine. We have had 3 appointments canceled or no show and cannot get a straight answer as to why. Appointments have been canceled because the part “wasn’t in”, even though I have proof that they checked the part in before canceling the appointment. We have had appointments canceled because the technician quit and then decided not to quit, but we weren’t put back on his schedule. Now, we are at over a month without a washing machine and an appointment scheduled for today with the technician that had, in fact, quit. The only way I found out that they wouldn’t be coming to fix our machine today, during our appointment that I confirmed last night, was by calling the company and waiting on the phone for nearly 30 minutes. They did not even call to let me know that the appointment for today was cancelled, or rather, should never have been scheduled.
It is nearly impossible to get in touch with anyone, and I have not been able to get in touch with a manager at all.

This is not a company that will be receiving any more of my business, nor would I recommend them to anyone. Please, do yourself a favor and find another company to fix your appliances.

name: Brian Vann
text:
I had a manufacturer warranty for repair and Lowe's assigned me to these people. I first called on 1/16/2021 and as of today my washer is still not fixed . This is the absolute worse company I have ever dealt with and cannot wait for my washer to be fixed so I can never use them again.

If you are given a chance to select a company avoid this one.

name: Maurice Flott
text: Got a new Maytag washing machine and the lack broke after 6 months later on a device what suppose have a good service brand. Call the factory and they gave the service call to S an S appliance and on 03/17/21 they sent a service guy out who was ready to go when he arrived. The factory told me prior to the service guy coming to my house that they already told S and S what the problem was and ordered the parts for the repairs in advance. The service guy S and S showed up as if this had never happen. He advised he was going to order the parts and will contact me and have it repaired in a couple of days and it May 12, the repairs never happened and even the factory had a hard time making contact with S and S appliance to get an update on to what happen.. I would not recommend using this company if they were located next door to my resident. They have not pride in customer service at all...I gave them a one star because the site want let you give them a half of one.

name: Judith Curry
text: "Fast and professional service! Knowledgeable and friendly technician. I will ask for him by name next time."

name: Breanna Collins
text:
No one will answer the phone nor will they respond to emails. I have literally called everyday this week and listen to the automated music for 30-45 minutes. I have left several messages and still will not respond and they have my parts to fix my washer!!!!
UPDATE: After leaving the above review the manager gave me a call and explained why they have been not responsive. I really appreciated that from them. I was set up the next day for the tech to return only to find out I needed another part. With that being said I will update once the job has been completed for my overall rating.
THIS TIME MY WASHER STILL IS NOT FIXED AND NO ONE TO CONTACT AS THE PHONE STILL SAYING CLOSED DUE TO HOLIDAY! I AM ANGRY AT THIS POINT. MY WASHER ISNT FIXED BECAUSE THE TECH SAYS HE CAN NOT GET THE SENSOR TO GO BACK ON.THIS IS NOW THE 3RD TIME AND THE TECH DID NOT SET ANOTHER APPOINTMENT AS HE SAYS HE DOESNT KNOW WHAT TO DO AT THIS POINT.

name: Clint Singletary
text: Worst service company I’ve ever had the displeasure of dealing with.  They showed up to diagnose an issue but have since no called/no showed for two appointments to install the parts we had to buy ourselves.  It’s impossible to get anyone on the phone.  They never respond to messages either.  If not for being a Maytag warranty vendor they’d surely be out of business because their communication is the absolute worst I’ve ever seen.

name: David Frings
text: S and S Appliance came out very quickly when we had cooling issues with our refrigerator. There repairman was knowledgeable and polite.  He repaired the problem and a very fair price.  I will always call S and S when I have an appliance issue!

resp.text: Thanks for the review David! Glad we were able to get you taken care of!

name: Jill chen
text: Scheduled an appointment for Whirlpool warranty service in Huntsville, AL for a minor repair for the first available time window, 4/23/21 between 8am-4pm. I waited at home during this time window. Nobody ever showed up or called. I made several attempts to call the company, but never got an answer.

name: Reed Robinson
text:
HANDS DOWN WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I'VE EVER DEALT WITH!
I'VE NEVER ACTUALLY TAKEN THE TIME TO WRITE AN ONLINE REVIEW UNTIL NOW.  They picked up our icemaker in Nov 2020.  As of May 26, 2021, the only person who will take our phone call is the repair technician who originally picked it up.  He has tried to get someone from the shop to call us, but no one ever has.  They NEVER answer their phone at the shop.  I've left several voice mails of which NONE have been returned.

name: Brittany Kelley
text: We’ve used this company for years and they never disappoint! Randy is by far the best tech and goes out of his way to make sure we understand what he’s done and what his plan is to get it fixed. If there’s ever anything parts wise that need ordered, he’s on it. If you need quality work from an amazing group of professionals, then call them! You won’t be disappointed!

resp.text: Brittany, thank you for the awesome review! We agree that Randy is a fantastic tech and love hearing that our customers are being taken care of.

name: michael gonzales
text: Warranty appt made by whirlpool  on 25 May.  S and S never called to verify appt on Jun 9.  So on Jun 9 at 8 am,  I and whirlpool tried calling S and S appliance, left messages, no return call.  Appt was 8 am to 1200 noon.  At 2pm I called again no answer, checked status of call via S and S website.  Appt by canceled at 805 by S and S appliance. Dryer.30 days  old.  Appt still on whirlpool site and doesn't show canceled

name: melanie boothe
text: I'm sure if I had been a paying customer this would have gone differently. But I wasn't, I needed warranty work done on a freezer/fridge combo that I had purchased 2 weeks before. The freezer was staying between 5° and 19°. I put frozen solid food in the freezer and it thawed. When Dave from S&S came out first off he reeked of cigarettes, after maybe 2 minutes of being there he said the freezer was 5° and he couldn't do anything for me. Said he would have to catch the freezer being 19°. I explained to him about the frozen food and he said 'ma'am, this isn't a deep freezer. I told him I understand that but I expect my freezer to keep food frozen. He told me again there was nothing he could do and said that the freezer was fine when he looked at it and insinuated several times that I was lying. When I tried to explain to him again that I could not keep a freezer that would not freeze, he snatched up his bag and told me to have a nice day and left. He was at my home maybe 6 minutes.

name: Patrick Taggart
text: Do not use this company.  We had been instructed to use S&S from Whirlpool, when our new dryer quit working.  We are now over 2 months without a working dryer.  The entire experience has been a disgrace.  From the delay in getting the technician out to verify the error code, to no shows to repair.  Can’t stress enough to avoid at all costs doing business with S&S.

name: Jordan Hulet
text:
Shane was on time, professional, and quickly fixed the problem. He was also very polite and courteous on the phone and in person.
My dishwasher flooded my kitchen. Shane came to look at it. He asked about the garbage disposal and I told him how a plumber told me I needed to get a particular electrician to come to fix some problem with the electrical outlet. Shane looked at the disposal for about 30 seconds, found the problem, and fixed it in about 2 minutes.
Shane came in to save the day and fixed both problems. He also gave me some helpful tips on keeping my fridge and dishwasher in working order. I will recommend him to everyone I know

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Jordan! Glad we were able to get you taken care of!

name: Jessica Allen
text: I was due an appointment today between 8am-12pm. I was call at 9am by this company stating they did not have the part they supposedly had 3 weeks ago. This company is an absolute joke. I have delt with this since Jan 15th. Also reported to BBB

text: So disappointed. I've been waiting 2 weeks on a part and I had an appointment and they never showed. I called to check and they told me 6 more days. They said they sent an email and I never received it. I took off work and I was expecting it to be fixed since it's literally a but that came off.

text:
Been waiting over a month to get the tech to replace a part on washing machine.
I called a was put on the schedule but never showed.
Called back and was told that the day he was to come out that it would be another 16 days before he would show up.
Not a good or reliable company to use.
Will never use them agsin.

name: Beth Brampton
text: What a nice impressive person very informative and pleasant helpful explaining to me where I could understand it. Thk u

name: Donald Stanton

text: HORRIBLE!!!! I have been waiting since November for the completion of the warranty repair on my dryer.  I have waited on hold for days and it just bumps you to a voicemail.  I did actually speak with someone a few weeks ago but she didn't know what happened to the parts for my order and  everyone had left for the day.  She would call me the next day.....no return call.  I have even tried creating a new service call; nope that doesn't work either!

name: Terrance Whitfield
text: I put a work order out through American Homeshield and they referred me to this company.  The work order dated  back to November 2020, for a whirlpool microwave oven.  John was the technician who arrived at our home two weeks later to give a diagnosis of the problem.... he advised that my microwave needed three fuses and they had to be ordered through the whirlpool warehouse..... I understand the impact COVID had on shipping but 3 months!!!! I finally contacted whirlpool myself to get a status update.... they advised that the part was in stock and s&s had not followed up for some time!!! Whirlpool shipped the item to me and I had to contact s&s to get John scheduled once again..... John (bless his heart) showed up out of breath.... preparing to fix my microwave.... heck I even helped him take it down.... there he was on my kitchen floor talking to himself and making noise.... he spent 3 hours so-call repairing.... finally we put the microwave back and he ask for water to test.... he put the water in, closed the door, and the microwave died again!!! He stated that was probably another fuse which would take several more weeks!!! I demanded that he condemn that microwave so I could get a new one.... John is a nice guy but I think it’s time for him to retire and live his remaining days fishing.... stay away for S&S!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Gary Thorne and Associates
text: Quick response, professional, courteous. Arron was a pleasure to work with. Would highly recommend him.

resp.text: Thanks for the review! Aaron is a great tech and I'm glad he got you taken care of!

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback Mark. I reviewed your job and unfortunately the parts to fix your dryer are no longer available so we were unable to fix it. We did get the parts for your stove and tried to reach out to you multiple times to schedule a follow up appointment but were not able to get you. We would be happy to repair it if you would still like us to.

text: I had an appointment today. Confirmed it via telephone last night. Service tracker said my job was complete but no one called or showed up. name: Lin's & Anth Kritikos
text: DO NOT USE THIS AWFUL COMPANY.  The technician cancelled or appointment after we'd been waiting for you weeks for repair.  Then the awful woman in the phone hung up on me.  So rude and unprofessional.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Mr. Lee. I'm really sorry but I couldn't find a job record under your name. Please, if you would like, reach out to me at wmoseley@sandsappliance.com and i will do anything I can to get you feeling better about your experience with S&S.

name: Lisa Kent
text:
This company is the most unprofessional company I have ever dealt with. You can read our nightmare of an experience on my husband's review, Shane Reimer.
I am just saying that the women in this office have lied and lied to me. They have been rude and unprofessional.  1 lady will tell you something then another lady will tell you something else. Either way we have never gotten our dryer fixed. From January 26, 2021 to April 5, 2021 they have gotten all parts in, sent them back, reordered them, and in this time made 6 different appointments with us.I tell my boss I need the day off because I am finally getting my dryer fixed and my boss now laughs at me.😔  We have been waiting on Tommy to call us back but Tommy is ducking calls because he has no excuse. Tommy need to be replaced by someone who can get the job done and the women in the office need to be replaced by an automated machine because it would be more help. This company should not even get 1 star.

text: If I could give it zero stars I would! This "business" was chosen by our home warranty company and after almost 2 WEEKS OF HAVING TO WAIT to get our freezer repaired they had their rude and unprofessional secretary call me the morning of the appointment at 8:30 and inform me that their technician was overbooked and would not be coming to my home today. name: shane reimer
text:
Had an appointment on 1/27 to fix dryer. Technician showed up and was nice enough and said the parts would have to be ordered and would probably take 2 weeks to get. I didn't like it but i understood. Well 6 long weeks later they have all the parts. I received an email  to schedule my 2nd  appointment and the first available is another week away on a day i work so i took off work fo my appointment on 3/24 8AM-12PM. I also called S&S the morning  of appointment to confirm and she assured me my tech would be here close to 12 and would call me becore arriving. At 1140 he halls me and told me he never got the parts and my appointment had to be scheduled 3 weeks out and reorder parts. They promised me they would contact me via email within 48 hrs with a better solution. As of right now they scheduled a new appointment for 4/4 without even contacting me. 2 months and still no dryer.  I'll probably end up dropping my home warranty company for allowing this kind of service.
UPDATE..when i called S&S I was told Tommy (the supervisor) would return my call. Well its been 3 days and still no email or call from tommy. This might be th worse company i have ever delt with in my entire life. STILL WAITING TOMMY!

resp.text: Nicole, thank you for your review. We aim for every customer to be completely satisfied and I hate that it sounds like we've missed the mark so far in that regard. I reviewed your job file and it looks like we have sent a second tech out to give another diagnosis and he gave the same diagnosis as the first tech. With warranty calls, we don't make any money from the call until the job is complete so having jobs take extra time due to backorder parts is not only a big inconvenience to the customer, it is detrimental to our business so I promise that when we tell a customer that a part is on backorder, it's on backorder. If you would like, please email me at wmoseley@sandsappliance.com and let me know if there is anything I can do that would make you feel better about your experience with S&S.

name: Crystal Anderson
text: Chris has been out a few times and has always been very helpful and professional.  He has been able to troubleshoot the problems, fix them and explain the reasoning behind it.

name: John
text: Called my father with dementia retarded and handicapped. He broke our washer and left it full of water and draining out into our house. Said good luck and left.

name: Linda Urquhart
text: Didnt see them. They needed to reschedule at the last minute. Let's see if they make it on Friday...

name: marie sanders
text:
Referred to S&S through home warranty ( American Home Shield). Tec came to home within one week. He spent 15-30 minutes looking at washer. Tec stated it needed a part but due to age and cost of part they may replace washer instead of fixing.
This was a Friday at 12:00 pm. On Monday I called at 2:00pm to get a status of repair or replace,. Customer services women stated the tec had been working on my paperwork since 10:30 am that morning and that I will receive a call when he finished.
Tuesday, next day, I received a text from American Home Shield stating my repair request had been completed  and asked to rate S&S appliance on service.
I did not receive a call, email or text from S&S appliance.   I had to resubmit a work request through American Home Shield to get my washer repaired.

I paid the service fee. I did not receive any services through S&S appliance. They did not complete the job.  Very unprofessional.

name: Laura Murphy
text:
DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!!! Over a month and they still haven’t made it to my house to fix my dryer which is under warranty through Lowe’s. Each time they were scheduled to come....I received an email the day of stating they only had one technician and they rescheduled me. I went ahead and called another company and had it fixed within 24 hours.
I called Lowe’s warranty department and filed a formal complaint against this company. Everyone please do the same so they lose their contract with Lowe’s!!!!

name: Candy Rodgers
text:
I purchased this washer and dryer through a company but it’s a whirlpool brand and under warranty for 1 year trough the manufacturer.

I had my dryer for a total of one month before it just stopped working in October 2020 I called whirlpool and they set me up an appointment with this company (S&S)  the appointment was scheduled for two weeks out and they recommended I call to get added to the cancellation list. When I called It was an extremely long wait, but after 30 min of waiting and I was finally connected to Natoshia she was very professional and understanding and got me moved up by a day. So finally the man John came and looked at the dryer he said it was the timer and door switch and that he would have to order the parts and it would take a week.

After he left they ordered the part and scheduled me for another two weeks out.
The day of the appointment arrived and I got an email saying my appointment was canceled because part was on back order and so they rescheduled me for another two weeks out.
They had the part in a week before my actual appointment. So on the date of my appointment he called and told me it was miss-boxed so it’s the wrong part and would take another 4weeks to get the part in!!!!!

I stayed calm and called whirlpool and told them what was going on and they shipped the part out to me within 2 weeks.
He came yesterday put it on and now he says the dryer needs a new start button and a fan is broken
So he couldn’t see all the problems when he first came in NOVEMBER and looked at the dryer?
So now I’m stuck waiting AGAIN! But before John left he said he found the parts local in Birmingham and that he would try to get someone to go get them so he can come back the next day and install it.

I called today and got connected with a woman named Tammy and I explained the situation to her and she responded “well there’s nothing we can do, we’re ordering the part and we’ll schedule you for feb 3. Maybe you’ll get lucky and get it in on time” I told her what John said to me and she said “well ma’am we have to order them so you’ll have to wait” I replied to her that I can call whirlpool and get the parts sent within 5days that way they can come install it she said “no ma’am and if you get the parts yourself (from the manufacture) that it will void my warranty!

But That’s what I did with the other part and he came and installed it so I don’t know what the difference is.

I understand COVID has put a strain on a lot of things right now and I’ve been very patient and understanding with this company but it shouldn’t take 5months to fix a dryer!!! And today after the way that lady’s treated me I am furious. I will never use this company again and have called whirlpool and made them very aware of what’s happened and how I was treated they completely agreed it was unacceptable and after they finish this job they will no longer match me with S&S for my repair needs.

If nothing is done by February 3rd they will schedule me with another company.

The only reason I give this company two starts is because of Natoshia, she understands how hard and costly it is not having your appliances when having a large family and tried her best to help.

Covid  can’t be an excuse for everything, I suggest you hire some more technicians so customers aren’t waiting two weeks just to get their appliances looked at and I also suggest you hire more professional people to answer your phones.

name: James Sovel
text: The tech was fantastic! Professional, competent, nice, and quick!  Everything works again and and very happy with the service.  Thank you!!

resp.text: James, thanks so much for the review! We love hearing when our team does a good job and are happy to hear your appliances are back up and running!

name: Julie Gordy
text: This company at is unprofessional.  I have been waiting since August to get my microwave repaired.  I was assigned them thru American Home Shield. They came to the house then ordered the wrong parts. I was notified they say they were scheduled to come that they didn’t have the parts.  When the parts came in the microwave still didn’t work.   Then the repairman was sick again I was notified after he was supposed to be there.  They continue to try to come when I am not home instead of calling (like they promised they would )when they are on their way.    It takes sitting on hold a minimum of ten minutes before anyone answers and then they hung up on me.  I hope American Home Shield will pick a new appliance company to work for them.

resp.text: Ms. Gordy, first off, thank you for your review. We appreciate hearing from our customer whether it's positive or negative- although we much prefer people to have positive experiences. I'm extremely sorry that your experience has been unsatisfactory. We have been in business for 60 years and really take pride in taking care our customers that have allowed us to be here that long. I fully recognize that without you, there is no us. We are going through some very challenging times right now stemming from COVID. Parts are not as readily as we normally can due to industry wide manufacturing delays- we have been working as hard as we can to source parts from any available/approved vendor. Recently we've been having an extremely high incoming call volume, most of this is related to our parts issues with customers calling in to check the status of their parts and our customer service representatives spending extra time on the phone rescheduling customers whose parts are delayed. We are currently in the process of doing a complete overhaul of our phone system to handle to call volume but it is a process that has taken longer than expected to get done. We also have been following CDC protocol in regards requiring our techs to be tested if they are exposed or show symptoms and quarantining for 2 weeks if positive. This has caused us to need to hire and train new technicians and for our existing techs to unexpectedly miss work for a time ranging anywhere from a couple of days up to 2 weeks depending on if they are positive or not. I admit, this can be frustrating for both us and incredibly inconvenient for the customer but we are working every day to overcome these challenges and operate at the level of quality our customers deserve. I reviewed your service call record and wanted to let you know I would invite you to reach out to me directly via email at wmoseley@sandsapplinace.com if there is anything I can do to help turn your experience around.

name: John Powers
text:
Great outcome with S & S!
They called me the day before my appointment as a kindly reminder, then again a call to let me know they were on their way to my home. The service person (Tim) was on time, professional and courteous. He put protection on my hardwood floor for his tools, then fixed the problem with my dishwasher. The cost was reasonable. I was very satisfied and would highly recommend them. I will certainly have them back with my appliance servicing. Thanks Tim, and thanks S & S Appliance. In addition, the receptionist who took my initial call was very polite too! Thanks!
John L Powers

name: Troy T
text: Terrible company.  Forced to use them via my home warranty company.  They reschedule constantly, parts are never in/or come in late, and they dont fix anything.  On top of that the repairman stated to my face that the fridge needs to be replaced, but wrote it up and sent to my warranty company saying a part was needed (the part he tried to put in the same day and he failed to do so!).  Some of the people they send out are really nice, but overall you will be waiting a LONG time in between visits and your appliance wont be fixed.  Terrible experience with this company!  Use only if you want your blood pressure to rise.

name: Ashley Weil
text:
I am changing my 1 star review on this business to.a 4 star review. Everything negative l
Previously was true about many many ma y mistakes a d getting bgg the run around in the beginning. However, the company responded and apprised and explained what was going on. On their end. I can respect a company's honesty. I can forgive not of things with an apology and honesty. I wod not hesitate knowing what I do now to use them again.

resp.text: Ms. Weil, I'm extremely sorry that your experience was unsatisfactory. We have been in business for 60 years and really take pride in taking care of every single on of our customers that have allowed us to be here that long. As a company, we are going through some very challenging times right now stemming from COVID. First is not being able to get parts as readily as we normally can due to industry wide manufacturing delays- we have been working as hard as we can to source parts from any available vendor to get customers taken care of. Second is an extremely high call volume that we are getting, most of this is related to our parts issues with customers calling in to check the status of their parts and our customer service representatives spending extra time on the phone rescheduling customers whose parts are delayed. We are currently in the process of doing a complete overhaul of our phone system to handle to call volume but it is a process that has taken longer than expected to get done.  Lastly, technician availability has been a major challenge. We have recently had quite a few senior techs that had been with us for a while decide that now, with concerns regarding COVID, was the best time for them and their families for them to retire. We also have been following CDC protocol in regards requiring our techs to be tested if they are exposed or show symptoms and quarantining for 2 weeks if positive. This has caused us to need to hire and train new technicians and for our existing techs to miss work ranging anywhere from a couple of days up to 2 weeks depending on if they are positive or not. I admit, this can be frustrating for both us and incredibly inconvenient for the customer. We are working every day to operate at the level of quality we hold ourselves to. I couldn't find a job record under your name, but please reach out to me directly via email at wmoseley@sandsapplinace.com so I can get some additional details about your service call- I'll do whatever I can to make it right. Or at least correct the issue so it doesn't happen to any other customers.

name: Eric
text: Let’s just put it this way they came to repair my refrigerator after waiting more then a month with two rescheduled appointments. Instead of fixing it they destroyed it & now it’s irreparable, lost all my groceries. Tech didn’t know what he was doing. I wouldn’t recommend this ill professional company to no one. Stay far, far away. I still haven’t received a courtesy call from them after the tech said his boss would call.

name: Maggie Marcilliat Larche
text:
It took several weeks to get an appointment, and then several more to get the follow up visit. Our parts were on backorder for months, and I had to call in and wait on hold for 30 minutes any time I wanted an update. The one time we finally got an automated call with an update, their phone software malfunctioned, and it hung up on me.

My washing machine broke in August, and it was finally fixed in mid-December. Everyone is experiencing delays bc of Covid, but this was worse than most. Plus the communication was awful. They did eventually get the washer fixed, so two stars.

name: Regina Lewis
text: Maytag warranty selected this company, but Idk why they did? After reading the other reviews and experiencing this company first hand. I can say I think they are running a scam. I been waiting 3 months for this company to fix my washer. They don't do what they say they are going to do. I been promised phone calls at least four times. I haven't received them. I have to call them, and everytime I call I hear lies. Part hasn't come in yet? OK whatever... I could've ordered this part from any company, received it within a week or two, and put it on myself; but here I am still waiting on this sorry company to come fix my washer. It's been three months, and my patience are wearing thin about ready to get a lawyer. Maytag warranty has already paid for the part and labor, but I have no new part and no one has done any labor. They got over here quick to get money from maytag. They are taking their sweet time to actually do the work. I'm questioning has this Company ever fixed anyones stuff? Idk how they have 3 and a half stars. Must be a bunch of fake reviews on here. How are they still in business? Poorest experience I've ever had. I wouldn't recommend this company. I'll let y'all know if they ever fix my washer. Also I went back three years. This isn't a covid related issue. The company simply sucks.

resp.text:
Hi Regina, thanks for the review- unfortunately I couldn't find a job under your name- please email me at wmoseley@sandsappliance.com as I would like to look into your parts ordered and see if there is anything I can do to move the process along.

I want to clarify something for anyone reading this. With warranty covered service calls, we don't collect ANY money until the job is complete (with customer pay calls we collect the service call fee on the front end but don't collect parts and labor until the job is complete). In fact, we have to spend money to send a tech out to the house to diagnose (salary for tech and office staff, gas, time, etc.) and we pay for the parts on the front end. So until the job is complete and we are able to bill the warranty provider for it, we are in the hole financially on a job while we are waiting for parts. Manufacturing disruptions and distribution delays are a real thing we're dealing with- Google "appliance parts shortage" and there are many articles done by national publications regarding it. We cant just order parts from "any company", we have to order genuine parts from the manufacturer or an approved distributor. the parts shortage has had ripple effect throughout our business that has been an incredible challenge to deal with. Calls that would normally take a week from start to finish are now taking months, customers appointments get pushed back again and again because a date we were told a part would be in gets changed at the last minute and we have to call or email the customer to reschedule, more phone traffic to schedule/reschedule/update customers has led to much longer than normal wait times when calling our office, the list is almost endless of how it has affected our business this year.

Ms. Lewis, I just want to say that our company doesn't "suck". We are a family owned business that has been in operating for 60 years, and we didn't do that by "scamming" customers. Everyone that works here has a home and a family and knows what it is like for a major appliance to go out- it stinks and we want it to be fixed for you. We truly do care about our customers and are doing out best to get everyone taken care of but we are absolutely going though a really challenging time right now trying to overcome this obstacle with parts. I really do hate that it has caused you to have a bad experience but I hope that you will keep this in mind and show patience and empathy towards businesses in a time when there are so many small businesses going though challenges that they could have never prepared for and that you might not be aware of.

name: danielle prude
text: Crooks! Service was scheduled by the home warranty company I use. The technician stated I’d need an inner and outer tub and that he’d have to order the parts. I receive a call from the technician two days later stating the warranty company wouldn’t cover the parts or replace the washer. He stated he could repair it for $936. I called the warranty company to discuss what the technician stated and was told S & S never contacted them to provide an update. These people are not honest or professional. They received my $100 deductible and attempted to scam me out of close to a $1000. The company that completed the job provided a different diagnosis, thankfully it’s fixed and The warranty company didn’t require me to pay another deductible.

name: Cary March
text:
If you need a "repairman" to leave you waiting for months, return several times, and STILL NOT COMPLETE the repair, this is the place for you.  I had the bad luck of being routed to this company through a manufacturer warranty repair process, and they led me on a merry 4-month chase and ultimately did not even bother to test their "repairs".  I had to call in another company (fee for service) - had the repair completed the day after I called.

Terrible service, terrible outcome, and nothing but excuses.  Then tried to send me a bill for the warranty service!!

Avoid this company unless you are in the market for pain and suffering.

name: Patty
text: They had to reschedule so cant really give a rating

name: Christina Marks
text: AWFUL! My refrigerator broke AUG 4th.  Whirlpool scheduled a service appointment with S&S and that took place August 11th.  The tech said my refrigerator needed the complete inside sealed system replaced and he would have to order the parts. It took over a month to get these parts but when they finally came in another tech came to complete the job.  When he arrived, he decided the refrigerator didn't need the full parts and only changed what he thought it needed.  Left and the refrigerator still did not work.  I called whirpool again and they again sent this company.  The next guy decided it did indeed need the full sealed system and had to order the parts AGAIN. Here I am Oct 27, still no refrigerator. Still according to S&S waiting on parts...

resp.text: Ms. Marks, thank you for your review. We appreciate hearing from our customer whether it's positive or negative- although we much prefer people to have positive experiences. I'm extremely sorry that your experience has been unsatisfactory. We have been in business for 60 years and really take pride in taking care our customers that have allowed us to be here that long. I fully recognize that without you, there is no us. We are going through some very challenging times right now stemming from COVID. Parts are not as readily as we normally can due to industry wide manufacturing delays- we have been working as hard as we can to source parts from any available/approved vendor. We have recently had a few senior techs that had been with us for a while decide that now, with concerns regarding COVID, was the best time for them and their families for them to retire. We also have been following CDC protocol in regards requiring our techs to be tested if they are exposed or show symptoms and quarantining for 2 weeks if positive. This has caused us to need to hire and train new technicians and for our existing techs to unexpectedly miss work for a time ranging anywhere from a couple of days up to 2 weeks depending on if they are positive or not. I admit, this can be frustrating for both us and incredibly inconvenient for the customer but we are working every day to overcome these challenges and operate at the level of quality our customers deserve. I reviewed your service call record and wanted to let you know I would invite you to reach out to me directly via email at wmoseley@sandsapplinace.com if there is anything I can do to help turn your experience around.

name: Derek Breton
text:
Terrible service. Multiple visits without resolution. Came out four times for my hybrid care dryer and kept telling me lint was making the dryer scream. Also complained it was too new. Three times they told me the problem initially was that there was no vent hose. That model doesn’t use a vent hose. Then told me warranty doesn’t cover noise. Got someone else to come out and a bearing had to be replaced.
Also complained my fridge was too new and didn’t know how to work on it.
Then after having service for years with my extended warranty all they had to do was come in and repair the appliance and leave and collect their check. They went out of their way to report back to the warranty provider that there is a business in the home, that in no way uses the appliances, just to get my warranty canceled. Who does that?! They intentionally set out to get all my warranties canceled that I had been carrying and renewing for years. The warranty provider said it would have been fine if they hadn’t known but technically they can’t honor warranties if there is a business in the home. They didn’t know why the repairman took the time to report me. This repair man took the time to get my warranties voided even though it had nothing to do with the business. Biggest bunch of jerks I’ve ever met. I hope they go bankrupt tomorrow. Avoid at all possible costs. Worst company ever.

name: Andrea Holt
text: This place is horrible.     My (9 month old) dryer quit working on labor day weekend.  It's under warranty so they has someone come to my house and look at it. All he brought with him was a fuse. He said it was the timer  3 weeks later they sent someone else with the timer..but that guy said it was the motor.   Then they had to order a motor it was suppose to be in on october 15.  My husband found someone who refurbishes dryers and he came and looked at it and it was a fuse!!! Fixed it in less than 5 minutes.   It is now october 25 and I have yet to hear from them about he motor....that it doesn't need. They dont seem to know what they are doing

name: Meghan Davis
text: Ron with services is very friendly and professional.  He explains everything that he has done and will do. I WILL NOT use another company when it comes to maintenance to my appliances. Thank you so much Ron!!

resp.text: Meghan, thanks so much for your kind review! We really appreciate hearing from our customers. I have to agree with you, Ron is an excellent technician and takes great care of customers.

name: Lisa Braniff
text: My repairman was great. The office staff/scheduler was unprofessional and rude.

name: Jay Young
text: S & S Appliance is/was certified to work on JennAir appliances.  Our refrigerator that was under warranty quit cooling and we had the most unprofessional experience dealing with this company.  If I get into the details my blood pressure will rise, but whatever you do try your best to NOT USE THIS COMPANY.  I have never dealt with such an unprofessional group of people the entire staff and management (Dora, Buck, Pearl Ann, David, Tommy & Kayla), on 6/8/20 I was told management/ownership of Tim &/or Matt Powers would be reaching out to me but as you can imagine I haven't heard a word.  HORRIBLE SERVICE AND FOLLOW THROUGH!!!  Don't walk... RUN from this company if you have appliance service needs.

name: Jennifer Via
text: I hope the service team is better than the customer service team... I called to follow up on a service request placed today. I understand I was being fast paced, but very nice. There was no positive tone, no pleasantries, no friendly demeanor. I could tell she hates her job; that is unfortunate, but not the customer whose appliance requires a service calls fault. All I wanted is a time line of service and to confirm my item was serviced as the brand was no listed, but I could tell I was a nuisance to her. Beyond disappointing first impression during such a stressful time, we are limiting interactions, avoiding stores, and I lost most of what I had in my home fresh food wise, but I really hope their service team has a better attitude as I do TRULY appreciate their skill set.

name: Anna Harris
text: Service tech was rude and unprofessional. Spoke down to me the entire time and was unapologetic about being late. We had to use this company for a warranty issue but if you have the choice do NOT use. Terrible customer service! Maybe the worst I’ve ever experienced.

resp.text: Ms. Harris, I am very sorry that your experience was far less than what it should have been. Please email me at wmoseley@sandsappliance.com so I can get some more information and work to get this fixed.

name: Kelly Parrish
text: Ray was first-rate! Timely, thorough, and professional. Not only was he able to acurately diagnose my appliance problems, but he gave me a ton of tips to keep my appliances operating at optimal performance - I honestly got out paper and pen and took notes! Very polite and trustworthy. Thank you!

name: Ginny Choat
text: Cliff was wonderful! He came in and quickly found out how to repair/had the proper part and was done within 20 minutes. Cliff was courteous and even helped me clean behind and under appliance. Overall experience was quick and excellent!

name: Laura Morris
text: We had a home warranty claim on our dishwasher and they contracted S & S Appliance to come check it out. Most times we are disappointed in the companies our  home warranty sends to fix thing, but this time we were very happy with the company they sent. Rick Bock came and he was awesome. Not only was there no major issue with our dishwasher but he was so personable and funny.  We give him a thumbs up and enjoyed the comedic conversation while we waited to make sure all was right with the dishwasher. We highly recommend this company and especially Rick Bock!!!!

name: Chasity Rumph
text: Cliff was my technician. He came in, diagnosed my washer, and acted professionally. Then he came back to fix the issue.  He cleaned up the area thoroughly and put my appliances back in my laundry room correctly. Job well done!

name: Walton Foster
text: Ray at S&S not only repaired my 10+ year old dryer, he cleaned it out, removed the coins banging around the drum, and shared great information about how to get more years out of it. Additionally, he advised me about my dishwasher and how to make it perform better. Very knowledgeable and great customer service!

name: Mitch Green
text: Chris from the Bessemer location did as professional and timely a service call as I have seen in my lifetime. He was on time, explained the issue and how to avoid it in the future, came equipped with the parts needed for the repair without knowing what that was until he got here, made the repair in less than 20 minutes and cleaned up after he was done. Additionally, he went the extra mile to clean out the vent and inspect the dryer unit for any other potential problems that might pop up in the future. If all S and S service people are like Chris, they will be very successful. That’s the way customer service is suppose to work

name: tiffany bolton
text: Ray was amazing!!! He came right in and figured out the problem in 10 minutes!! He already had the part I needed in the truck and was able to fix it right away! He was super friendly and such a great help. Gave me great advice on questions I had about different products to use with the washer! Amazing experience! Will forever use them!

name: Lauren Bobba
text: Ray came today to fix our dishwasher (work order 191236). He was phenomenal. He had so many good tips for us that I would have otherwise never known. He gave me a tutorial on how to use my dishwasher (much needed) that should resolve all of our issues. Thanks, Ray.

name: MissYummyLollipops
text: Your drivers should drive the speed limit not 50 in a twenty mph on airport road in destin Florida today. I would not recommend this company due to this factor is already hazardous wouldn't want this kind of employee doing any kind of work in my home.

resp.text: You're absolutely right. We definitely expect our drivers to follow all traffic laws and drive safely. Please call and let us know if you ever see one of our vans driving in an unsafe manner and we will immediately address the issue.

name: Bobbie Coleman
text: Quick and efficient

name: Gayle Harp
text:
Axxton came to our condo and fixed our dishwasher and was so polite and knowledgeable. The two days later, we noticed our ice maker was not making ice and we were able to get him back to check it and replaced the ice maker.  He is great and gets the job done every time.  Excellent worker

Gayle Harp

name: Todd Owen
text: Have a Maytag dishwasher that quit working in September. A technician came out for 5 minutes and said it was a bad pump motor and they would have to order one. Two weeks later they cancelled the return appointment because the part had not come in so they scheduled to come back in another two weeks. They cancelled that appointment also. S & S said they were having trouble getting parts from Maytag. I called Maytag and got not one but two replacement pump motors in three days on my doorstep. I called S & S to reschedule once again. This time it was going to take three weeks to get someone to fix the dishwasher. The day before they were scheduled to come and fix the dishwasher they once again cancelled the appointment. They said it would be an additional three weeks before they could come out. After arguing with them they finally decided to come out the following Wednesday. The technician came out, worked on the dishwasher for about an hour, then left. After all of this trouble THE DISHWASHER IS STILL NOT WORKING. Do not buy a Maytag and definitely do not use S & S.

name: Alex Kuck
text: I have had a couple Whirlpool appliance repairs done by S&S. Each time they come out, the repair technician is very professional, knowledgeable and informative. Our most recent repair was made by Ray who came out in the time frame provided and called ahead to be sure someone would be home. He gave us many tips and advice on not only the appliance he was fixing but others in our home as well. He made the repair in a timely manner and cleaned up any mess that was left behind. I definitely recommend S&S for any appliance repairs!

name: Stu Dabbs
text: Great response and accurate diagnosis!!  Would use again.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Stu! We really appreciate you and are happy that you were satisfied with your experience!

name: Lauren Kidd
text: Rick Bock serviced my washing machine yesterday and provided excellent customer service! He called me before he came to my home to make sure that I was there, which I appreciated. Once he arrived, he went straight to my machine and performed a diagnostic check. Once he recognized the problem, he explained to me what was going on and fixed the problem. He also explained to me what I could do monthly to improve the functionality of my machine. Thanks!

name: Margaret Rogers
text: Axxton Southwick from S&S Appliance repaired our clothes washer.  We had had several repairmen work on it and finally Axxton came.  He found the problem and fixed it.  We have had no problems since then.  Thank you so much as it had been a horror with out of balance.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Margaret! We think Axxton is a great technician also. Glad that he got it fixed for you and that you were please with your experience!

name: Mark Gilmore
text: This company never answers the phone. I have been trying to complete a service request for 5 months. I have called 3 days in a row. My insurance company has reached out to them on many occasions, and they still haven't responded.

resp.text: Hi Mark, thanks for the review- I just need to start off with that we communicate (not always over the phone) with your home warranty company pretty much every day. Your make and model of dryer is not very common so we had to get your insurance company to help us source the part- no big deal, it's fairly common for us to do this. We sent them the part number that we needed and they sent us the wrong part (we need a control board and they sent us a console panel). We reached out and let them know that was not the part we needed and restated the correct part that we need, they sent us another of the same consoles. We have reached out to them and let them know again and are waiting for the correct part. I completely understand your frustration surrounding the situation, but I think it is misplaced towards us and should be directed towards your home warranty company. They have sent us the wrong part twice now, and are telling you false information that they cannot get in touch with us. Like I said, this particular home warranty company we communicate with on a daily basis. Please reach out to me at wmoseley@sandsappliance.com if you have any questions.

name: Seth Reeves
text: 189380, Ray. Went above and beyond with his service. We called him out for a service on on washer and dryer. He looked at the machines and ran the diagnostic tests and stuff, but he also told me all about the small nuances with their functions and how to get the most out of my laundry. Ray was also really friendly and we had a normal conversation while he was working. On top of doing what we called him out to do, he noticed the detergent pods we use for our dishwasher (Cascade Platinum) and how we should only be using those for pots and pans with a lot of food residue. If there isn’t any food residue, the soap will stay on the dishes, and the heat from the dryer will cake it into your cups and plates.
