And then when you use your dishes later, you are consuming the baked-on soap and basically poisoning yourself. He recommended using the 12x power pods and not rinsing or scrubbing the dishes off beforehand. Overall, Ray was a really nice guy who did more than expected. I learned a lot in the little time he was at my house.

name: Rebecca Sikorski
text: Ray came out to repair my refrigerator door. I mentioned to him that I had just had a new dishwasher installed that same day. He asked if the installer showed me how to use it (he hadn't) and then spent 30 minutes showing me the features of the dishwasher and tips for keeping it running well for years to come. He had my refrigerator fixed in no time at all. He went above and beyond what he was hired to do. I can't say enough good things about my experience with this technician and company. Highly recommend!

name: Lisa G.
text: They don't never answer the phone I have been without my dryer for 2months..

resp.text: Lisa, I apologize about the wait to get though on the phones. We do answer the phone- all day long. We just have a ton of people calling us recently and have had employees out for extended periods of time. We welcome our customers to book an appointment on our website or submit request that someone contact them so that you don't you don't have to wait on hold. Feel free to email me at wmoseley@sandsappliance.com and I will see what the hold up is with your dryer. I would say with a fair amount of certainty that if you have been waiting for two months, there is a part that is on backorder from the manufacturer, and unfortunately at this time we are at the mercy of the manufacturers regarding the supply of parts.

name: Kelley Winslett
text:
Rick was our service tech repairman. He was punctual, courteous and was able to diagnose the issue with our dishwasher. He returned with the correct part and had the dishwasher back up and running in no time. We have contacted S & S for any repair needs and certainly will again in the future!
Thanks, Rick!

name: Mitzi George
text: Cliff is the best! He found 2 issues after another company found nothing. So refreshing to have a good Christian that cares about his customers.

name: Mark Williams
text: Tim was our technician and he was awesome. He accidentally ordered the wrong part, but made it right. He showed up when he said he would. I was very impressed.

name: Rebecca Lewis
text: I have nothing but good to say about my experience with S & S. My home warranty company made the appointment for my refrigerator, and I knew nothing about them. Marsha, in the office, was kind enough to get me in  several days before their initial first available appointment, and Jim Johnson was the very experienced service tech who did a great job....a very successful service appointment.

name: brett terry
text: S&S has been a pleasure to work with in fixing my freezer and icemaker.  It’s nice having a company that will inform you every step of the process and not leave you hanging as to when they will arrive or complete the service.  Their service man Chris was very professional and was able to fix our issue within the initial frame we were given. After experiencing the level of professionalism and service provided by s&s, we will only be using this company for any of our appliance service needs in the future.

name: Marcus Burks
text: Ray was fantastic. Very knowledgeable and professional. He even took the time to educate me on how to get best results for other appliances. Ray is the type of technician that you hope for when you schedule a service call.

name: Pat Connor
text: Ray from S&S came yesterday to service my dishwasher.  He did an awesome job of diagnosing issues and explaining a lot to me about my dishwasher I did not know.  I would definitely recommend them to anyone who had appliance issues!

name: Debra Cook
text: They came out but could fix my problem. Tech said get platinum wash and rinse.  Pathetic. No one should have to do that

resp.text: Thank you for the review Debra. I apologize if you feel like my tech didn't do anything but unfortunately that is the way dishwashers and detergent are made these days. You need rinse aid because dishwasher detergents don't work the same as they used to. Every new dishwasher has a rinse-aid dispenser because rinse aid is essentially mandatory if you want your dishwasher to dry dishes well. Feel free to contact me at wmoseley@sandsappliance.com if you have any additional questions.

name: The Browns
text: I had a service call for a refrigerator repair and Chris was the serviceman that came by.  Chris was VERY knowledgeable and personable.  I would highly recommend your company based upon the high-level of customer service Chris provided.

name: BeachNutty Brad
text: Very prompt to respond to calls.  Had to come out multiple times for unrelated instances and they were on time on the days they scheduled. They were also very professional and knowledgable.

name: Renae McCullough
text: Ray did an awesome job - took the time to identify and replace another issue that he found (in addition to the one he came out for).  Called prior to arrival and worked quickly.  Will use again!

name: Jackson Motel
text: Currently have a warranty with American Home Shield and they usually send the worst people to get work done and takes weeks if not months to get something done. Well this time I was totally wrong. From the guy I talked to on to my technician RICK was a great experience all the way around. GREAT JOB GUYS!!!

name: Ladonna Swain
text: Ray did an outstanding job in his professional skills. Came in and know what the problem was and resolved the issue with my Amana washing machine and  also give me tips on how much detergent to use on each level of water cycle from high to low.  I would like to have him anytime to come out for service.

name: Brian Jones
text: Ray did an awesome job fixing our refrigerator! It’s finally fixed, he was very professional and knowledgable!! I would recommend this company to fix your appliance needs!

name: Nameless Faceless
text: I cannot say enough good things about Ray, the service technician, who came to my rescue when my washer was broken. He was professional, courteous, and knowledgeable. He shared lots of tips and tricks to help me save money and time on laundry while working on my washer. Ray called me before and asked some simple questions about what exactly was going on with my washer. This allowed him to come totally prepared for our appointment. He had everything he could possibly need to fix my washing machine. Ray arrived promptly at the discussed appointment time and even stayed later to check the machine and make certain that everything was in working order. I could not be happier with the services rendered and will not hesitate to use this company again with any of my appliance needs.

name: Jackie Swale
text: Ray did a great job fixing our dryer! He was quick and kind and now our dryer works great when I was afraid we would have to buy a new one! Definitely recommend!

name: Brenda Mashburn
text: Ray Crawford was very knowledgeable about my Maytag stove. He spent time answering all my questions and giving me additional information on another appliance. Very professional!!! I will definitely contact him for any additional appliance needs!!!

name: Jordan Whitfield
text: Ray was exceptional! On time, polite, informative and knowledgeable. Definitely recommend and will be keeping his car for any future issues.

name: Real Estate Chris Lindsey
text: I had a service call for a dishwasher repair and Ray was the serviceman that came by.  Ray was VERY knowledgeable and personable.  I would highly recommend your company based upon the high-level of customer service Ray provided.

name: Mohamed Khass
text: One of the most bad experience I have. I called them and sent me the technician after a week and half because this specific technician  does not come to my area unless one day in the week. When he came he started checking my appliances (refrigerator, Stove) and take pictures of the models. Then he decided not to fix any thing and said I am not going to help you in any thing. Try another vendor. This is really inappropriate behavior.  I do not recommend any body to use them.

resp.text: Mr. Khass, thank you for your feedback. I'm very sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with your experience. I looked at the job history and the tech said he was not able to work on the appliances due to the presence of what appeared to be an insect infestation- that is what he was taking pictures of. Our techs are instructed to not work on appliances where this is the case for a couple of reasons. The first is sanitation, the second is that we provide a 90 day warranty on all of the repair work that we do. When an appliance has insects in it, we cannot put a guarantee on the work we do on that appliance.

name: Cookie Swirl gt
text: I have to say I had no problems. They called to let me know when they were coming. The young man was courteous. He quickly found the problem and resolved it. I would definitely use their services again. Thank you.

name: paul mcclintock
text: Worst customer service I have ever had service dept will not stay in contact with me or return phone calls

name: L B
text: Mr. Cliff Morgan is an excellent tech. He service my dryer and explain my problem thoroughly and he is very professional. Thank you S&S Appliance the experience was greatly appreciated.

name: lah0924
text: Cliff came out to see why my nearly new Whirlpool washer wasn’t going in to the rinse cycle, or advancing through the cycles as it should. I thought I had done all the trouble shooting. Turns out the machine was getting cold water due to recent plumbing work I had done. He called before he arrived, quickly performed diagnostics, and told me what was wrong. He even went as far as to show me by swapping the hot and cold hoses that the machine was going to work just fine once the plumbing issue was corrected, which I really appreciated. As a female living alone, I worry about things breaking that I can’t fix. He was very friendly and professional. Would use again!

name: john kinney
text:
Just moved to Alabama,  Huntsville.  We have had trouble with our refrigerator and Chris has put forth his knowledge to get us up and running.
He is very prompt and cordial, an excellent representative of S&S Appliance.

name: Debbie Reese
text: After waiting two weeks for an appointment they canceled without notifying me. Then indicated the next appointment would have been at least another month but still could not give a definite date. Went with another company and had washing machine repaired on same day I called.

name: Charles Coker
text: Called for service. Repair man came out and diagnosis the problem. Ordered parts. Took 2 weeks for parts to come in. Was scheduled to for repair on Tuesday but not given a time. It is now Wednesday still waiting on guy. No phone call to cancel or anything. Called to see what happened and was told they do not know as the repairman has not moved and they do not know where he is. Will have him to call me. Still waiting on call

name: D'Shundra McCray
text: Professional! Very thorough and knowledgeable about my dryer. Fast and friendly. I would recommend.

name: Bethany Burger
text: WORST company ever!!! Hey do not value customers and they are extremely rude to you in the phone. First I was told by one guy, “I don’t know who you guys are but it’s not me” I said yes you guys, your company told me! Then I was put on hold and Andrew got on the phone and he said I did need 2 parts and now I need 4 parts because the guy that had the other 2, quit!!! I asked why I wasn’t informed that it would be longer(because I’ve already been 3 weeks without my brand new $2000 dryer not working) his response was this: “ I’m sorry, I have over 200 customers and by 3:48 in the afternoon, I do not have any empathy left for you.” I hung up the phone. Only got one star because I cannot give 0!!!!!

name: steven murray
text: Warranty thru Lowes for my washing machine , came on time both times ordered parts came in within week and was polite and prompt.

name: Ed Burtnett
text: Randy did a great job replacing the ice maker in our Whirlpool refrigerator. Definitely recommend.

name: terrell haley
text: I got a smart guard plan for my dryer. They sent this place out to repair it. 1. The technician showed up a day early . It was good I happened to be home. 2. He couldn't fix the problem. He said they didn't have the parts for that dryer and that the service people would be getting back to me. I waited over a week and never heard anything. So I called smart guard. Come to find out they had lied on their notes. Saying that the technician couldn't find any problems wrong with the dryer. Smart guard is now going to make it right. But I tell you if you are looking for someone to work on your appliances look else where. My cat would do a better job. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME. THESE PEOPLE ARE CROOKS!!!!

name: Laura Taylor
text: Ray fixed our dishwasher today.  He was on time and very knowledgeable.  Would definitely recommend!

name: MARTHA WING
text:
We were more than pleased with our service today. Our technican, Doug, was definitely on time,  called before arriving and even arrived earlier than we expected.
He was very friendly and professional. Took complete care of our refrigerator problem , answered all questions and took extra time to show my husband somethings.  We could not be more pleased with S & S Appliances.  I would recommend.  I would like to add that I did receive an email and call from main office confirming appointment time and details of service. I called the morning of our service to make sure we were on the list for our appointment and they assured me we were.  Just wanted to add this information because the main office was very nice.

name: Bo R.
text: Ray from S&S was extremely professional, friendly, and courteous for my Whirlpool refrigerator warranty repair this morning. He installed the broken part quickly and without complication. I would definitely recommend S&S!

name: Nicole Hardin
text: I had a Wonderful Educational Experience with the technician that came out to my house to fix my Dryer...((** Ray Crawford **)) He called when he was 45 minutes away and arrived right on time....He fixed my Dryer in a timely manner. He also informed me of alot of diffrent things to do & not to do with my dryer. And every Question I had he immediately had an answer for it. He was very Professional, Knowledgeable,and Kind. I would most Definitely Recommend S&S Appliance, based on Ray being such an Awesome Friendly Technician!!!!!!It would be nice if every Technician, in all fields of work could be like him!!!!

name: Wendy Brown
text: S & S was the second appliance company to come out and look at my dishwasher. The first guy said he hadn't seen any made like mine. Ben came out & knew what the issue was. He ordered the part and came today to fix. The issue was not as bad as he previously thought so it did not cost near the estimate I was given. Considering I know nothing about the mechanics of a dishwasher, he could easily have charged me the original estimate but he was very honest and professional. I would recommend Ben & S & S to anyone!!

name: Debbie Glasgow
text: Today, Saturday, Randy Wilson came and fixed my refrigerator! He was so helpful and had a wonderful attitude! I will use S&S again. Thanks Randy!

name: Fred Gilliam
text: After 2 other technicians came out we were still having the same problems with the refrigerator freezing food and the freezer leaving foods such as ice cream soft.  Ray was able to diagnose the problem within minutes and is now setting us up with another technician who can fix the problem.

name: James Roberts
text: I’ve used S&S Appliance for over 20 years and normally got fairly good service. It’s now almost impossible to get someone to answer their phone. I finally got them to call back after leaving a message in their voice mail after trying for two days of calling to get an answer. I tried setting an appointment to repair my range and they told me it would be 2 weeks before a service person could do it. I don’t know what has happened with this company, but I don’t recommend them anymore!

name: Rebekah Rogers
text:
If I could ever get a hold of them that would be great. Half the time I call and it just rings and rings. They also messed up my appointment times and scheduled me for the wrong time of day, which is why I’m calling.

UPDATE: They came out, diagnosed the problem, said they would be back one week later with parts. They never showed up, I STILL cannot get a hold of them, and they have made no attempt to tell me when they’ll be back. This company is a joke.

name: Timeka Campbell
text: Excellent service. Fast, Professional and Reliable. Awesome Technician. Would definitely call for service again and recommend!!!

name: Jim Macher
text: Ray quickly diagnosed the issue with my Kitchenaid Range.  Very courteous, called ahead, and arrived when promised.

name: Rick Harrelson
text: Service representative, Axxton, was exceptionally conscientious when he performed warranty work on my KitchenAid refrigerator on service order 18858. Thanks for the great service.

name: Marilyn James
text: Today S&S service tech, Ray Crawford, repaired my KitchenAid dishwasher. He was professional, prompt and knowledgeable. I highly recommend S&S.

name: Jatin Patel
text: Keep delaying service

name: Tom Henderson Jr.
text: On time, very, very, very professional. Fixed my refrigerator quickly and explained the problem in detail.

resp.text: Tom, thanks for the review! Glad to hear we were able to get you taken care of quickly and the issue was explained to you. We hope you think of us next time you're in need- hopefully it's not too soon. Take care.

name: Cari Smith-Pointer
text: S & S sends skilled and courteous techs. Cliff and Rick were both excellent for repairing my refrigerator.

name: Bobby Freeman
text: Very late so far appointment time was 8-12 and haven't seen or heard from anyone yet

name: Michele Wells
text: Great service. Repairmen care about getting the problem resolved and are very helpful.

name: Richard Bock
text: Marcia, buck, Kayla  and Dora are awesome responding to call when needed they are exceptional in there-job and would recommend anyone that needs questions answered to ask for any 1 of them

name: Randy Ford
text: I've used them for parts for years. I've never had any problems at all, and they have always been very helpful, including ensuring that I tested to see if it was really a $5 part that was bad instead of the $100+ one I was buying. Asking for 10% off of 1 item per visit, (web coupon), makes them competitive w/ ordering online. They've always had the parts I needed online. They also give good advice about how to fix appliances yourself.

name: Lynn Johnson
text:
RUN from this company-our home warranty set them up to come look at our stove that had been down for 3 days.  I read the reviews and thought Oh great-here we go.  I was pleasantly surprised that they called when they were on their way, the customer service people were quite nice and the service guy seemed knowledgeable. He arrived on time, and upon inspection of the stove, found a wire that had shorted out.  The previous week, out of nowhere the stove flipped the breaker and blew sparks all over my kitchen.  He fixed that and left-after ensuring the stove could be turned on without the breaker flipping again.  After he left, I kept noticing that something smelled like it was getting hot so I checked on the stove.  The oven was fine and no smell was coming from it.  However, when I stood in front of the stove to check the oven, I immediately felt heat coming from the warming drawer-even though it was off.  Somehow, either the original problem that the tech didn't find or something he did bypassed the off button on the warming drawer and had it on high all the time with no way to turn it off.  Had I not been home, in all likelihood, we would have had a house fire.  I tried to call him back on his cell and he didn't answer and the company had closed and doesn't have an after hours/emergency number (it was a Saturday when they came and they must close at noon).  DON'T use this company or if you do, make sure you are home the rest of the day in case something like this happens to you.

The home warranty dispatched a different company after I let the have it and the second guy found the problem-when the stove flipped the breaker and blew sparks everywhere, apparently it fused part of the circuit board so the warming drawer was on-and on high-all the time.  The guy from S and S didn't even look at the circuit boards and didn't stick around long enough to tell there was a problem.

name: Myron Dawson
text: Didn't have what i needed.but told me where to get it

resp.text: Myron, thanks for the review! Hate that we didn't have the part for you but glad we were able to point you in the right direction.

name: J Doss
text: Would be nice if the people you talk to give you enough time to find the information that they say they need before hanging up in your face. If it's that serious and you guys are in THAT big of a hurry, then I will take my business elsewhere!

name: Stephanie Burgin
text: We had a few things that needed fixed, and Ray was the one to do the job. Very professional, polite, and knew exactly what he was doing.  Thank you again Ray!!

name: Will Rainey
text: Very rude, down talking to customers and not interested in customer service.

name: Carl Lane
text: Axxton Southwick was our service technician yesterday to repair our Whirlpool refrigerator.  Not only did he fit us in several days early but he did a great job.  He was very courteous and professional.

name: William Syphurs
text: I have used this company on several different occasions to buy parts. They are very knowledgeable and have the parts I have needed on hand. I highly recommend S & S!

name: Jan Hajek
text: Ray Crawford serviced my washing machine today. He did a fantastic job. Thank you

name: Aliesha Hansen
text: Pleased with S & S scheduling and service for our washer repair! After a horrible experience with Maytag repair service through Sears (no-show technician after I waited 2 wks!), I called S & S. The scheduling process was straightforward, and technician arrived when promised. He was courteous and diagnosed the problem. A part had to be ordered which meant the technician had to come a second time to install the part. Again, he arrived when promised and only took 10–15 minutes to install the new part. I had a very good experience and would recommend S & S!

name: cheryl washington
text: Ray was a very good technician.He was very helpful and knowledgeable about the product.I  will recommend S&S to all my family and friends

name: Fran Hornsby
text: Ray came out to fix my dryer. He was very prompt, did an excellent job diagnosing and fixing the problem and also gave me some helpful information about the use of my washer and dryer.

name: Allen Koch
text: Chris was the tech that came to our home to fix our washing machine and he  did a great job and very friendly.

name: Lisa Woods
text:
Ray was my Service Technician , he was very knowledgeable  &  courteous ,
&  always on time for my appointment,
Repairs were done fast , I will always use S&S in the future, & I recommend you to ask for Ray.

name: Megan Schrimsher
text: Ray Crawford was on time, communicated the issue in a way that was understandable, and went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of. Highly recommend!!

name: austinpt100
text: Where do i start? With the incompetence or stupidity? I don't recommend this licensed level of incompetence to anyone!! So save yourself the frustration and don't use them my home owners warranty service sent them to my home, USELESS!!!

name: Rosemary Range
text:
I BOUGHT A KITCHEN MAID REFRIGERATOR IN JUNE AND IT DID NOT WORK PROPERLY SINCE I BOUGHT IT ...….WITH TWO REPAIR PERSONS COMING AT DIFFERENT TIMES.

THIS THIRD TECH WAS TOTALLY PROFESSIONAL, KNEW HOW TO REPAIR AND VISUALLY DIAGNOSE AS WELL AS HANDS ON.

RICK BOCK IS THE BEST.  THE CONTINUOUS WHINING BECAUSE OF THE WRONG SIGNAL, INDICATING THAT THE DOOR WAS OPEN; ONLY BECAUSE WHEN IT WAS CONSTRUCTED, THEY LEFT IT UNLEVEL.

NOW....NO NOISE, LIGHTS ON AND HOPEFULLY ICE SOON.  THANK YOU RICK BOCK, THEY NEED 20 MORE LIKE YOU!!!  BLESSINGS

name: bekah morrow
text: Ray was kind, quick and he had great helpful hints for cleaning and maintaining our oven.

name: Amanda Osborn
text: My 9 month old washer messed up & this was the company Whirlpool was sending to repair it. I will admit that after reading the reviews I was quiet hesitant to use them. They called & sent an email confirming the date & time of the service. The technician, Mike, called when he was an hour out to let me know he was on his way. He was very courteous, explained the problem & reassured it was definitely a manufacturer error & not a user error, & rescheduled me for a week later to repair it. The following week I again got an email & automated call the day before, & Mike called that morning to let me know he was on his way. After an hour of working on my washer it is now good as new, & I am very thankful for Mike & his services! After several bad encounters with faulty appliances & mediocre repair services, it was a relief to have someone who wanted to do their job & make a costumer happy!

name: Will Watkins
text: I had an appointment with this company but they failed to show up nor did they call. When I called them regarding the issue, the lady put me on hold for over 30mins and never returned to the line. Very unprofessional.

name: Colby Sims
text: I normally don’t leave reviews but Kayla Norris in customer service needs to be recognized with five stars!

name: Carl Mansell
text: Rick, the technician identified and corrected the problem with our dryer.  He did not have to spend hours to identify the problem.   We would definitely recommend S&S Appliance, Parts and Service.

name: Jenny Brown
text: Tech Ray Crawford was very helpful and resolved my issue quickly and professionally.

name: Roscoe
text: Whirlpool sent S&S out for a refrigerator repair.  Tech arrived on time, diagnosed the problem and ordered the parts.  Refrigerator had to thaw out first. Kent was the tech.  Repair done very fast and he answered all my questions. Communication was excellent with S&S.  I would not hesitate to use them again. The only con is the $89.95 service call.

name: Matt Johnson
text: All I can say is that Tim Smith is the man!!! Very professional and extremely hard working. He came into the house with a mission to complete the work and didn't miss a beat. He was also very safe in checking to make sure that power was off. I'm very impressed with the work that was performed.

name: Eric
text: Ray was great! Friendly and easy to work with.

name: Kathy Williams
text:
Got an appointment within one day.  Randy Wilson was very friendly and
knowledgeable. I explained the problem.  He knew the answer immediately.
Fixed it fast.  Would use them again and recommend their service.  This
was a Whirlpool washer and dryer.

name: Tom Madonia
text: After about 3 weeks and numerous phone calls to both customer service at Whirlpool and S&S Appliance the repair was completed. There was a lack of communication between Whirlpool and S&S. It shouldn’t take 3 weeks to make a 45 minute repair.

name: chad biernacki
text: 1 Star is way to positive a rating for this place. They were referred  for warranty work. Came out originally and diagnosed the problem. Stated they needed to order parts. They scheduled three or more follow up appts over an almost two month span. Repeatedly said the parts were in would set up a time and date only to say they were on back order. At one point blamed a technician and stated they were no longer working for them.  The last two times two times they set up an appt they again said they had parts even the one on backorder. When it came to day of said the parts they had all along were not there. The final time they called same day as appt and stated a part was damaged. In summary this place is full of excuses. Oh and if you get the female receptionist she isn't a pleasure to deal with.

name: Angela Addison
text: Technician checked my washing machine.  Went out to his truck replaced a part and then when he was finished told me it would need another part.  He told me it would cost more to fix it than replace it.   He then gave me a bill of $211.65.  When, I questioned the cost.  He told me not to worry about it.  It's close to Christmas let your husband fix it.  I let him know, I don't have a husband.  He said my girlfriend could get it then.  He said this as he was going out the door.  The job took less than 30 mins.  I have had other technicians come out.  I have always been given an estimate of how much it would be before any work was done.  When I tried to reach the company.  I got an email back it said sorry for the way you were treated.  They never spoke of why, I was charged for a service that didn't fix my machine and will have to replace it.  I hope no one else has this happen to them.

name: AMARIE W
text:
👎👎👎THEY DESERVE A NEGATIVE 10 👎👎👎
The service repair guy Came out to service my Whirlpool fridge that  wasn’t properly dispensing ice....and ordered the part in October. ( a new left side door)....  he acknowledged that the door was deformed and instead of ordering a NEW fridge he ordered PARTS to replace..In the meantime he use cardboard and tape to produce a makeshift knob for the ice dispenser to connect..He was very rude and told me do not call him and he would only call me when the part is available I may receive it as a Christmas gift but do not continuously call looking for the part it will only prolong the process. I received the part in LATE FEBRUARY!!!!!  I took off work to schedule the appointment for the repair man to arrive he came on the day of the appointment but he did not have the parts to repair the fridge.  He now has to come back for a third time with the part blaming others because he did not deliver the part.  I rescheduled the appointment for the following week. He came with the part this time. The repair guy acknowledged that he’d never serviced my model fridge..saying it would be the first time for both of us.... he replaced the door..... an “easy fix” took 2 1/2 hours... and he did not replace the parts back in the fridge as he’d removed from the old..... He could not remember which wire went to what...  he was so short that I had to give him a chair to stand on to service the fridge...  I tried to explain to him that certain wires did not belong in that area but he was a know it all and put the fridge back together in the way that he wanted...  he then told a family member that was at the home that he could keep the old door at my home to use the door for fishing and to scale fish with the door.  I then asked him to take the door with him because I did not need trash in my home and I am not a hoarder....  he rudely ask my family member if he wanted to keep the door my family said it doesn’t matter to him so the repair guy left the door in my home!!!!!! I tried  explaining to the repair guy that the  door open indicator light should go off instantly when the door is closed.  He continued to work on the light and became very frustrated with me because the indicator light stayed on at least three minutes with the door closed completely..... indicating that the door was still open. I tried to FURTHER explain to the repair guy that  The doors were not aligned properly.  He insisted that the indicator light was to stay on two minutes at most and he was pleased after the light went off and he went home.... I was Livid!!!!!!!!!!  LONG STORY SHORT..... the fridge is now broken!!!! The motor hasn’t turned on I since Monday and the fridge is like a Sona. The ice maker has leaked water all over the floor about 2 weeks after the repair.... the opened door light indicator never worked properly after his repair. and no lights come on other than the interior... and the entire fridge QUIT on Monday....... an 8months NEW fridge...... THANKS REPAIR MAN...... for nothing...!!!!!!!... water on the floor and soaked through floor....... 200 dollars in fresh food RUINED!!!!! After an Escalated complaint to whirlpool they agreed to send out a new unit but it will take three weeks to deliver from the manufacturer.......... I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS COMPANY  you will be better off trying to repair it your self even if you don’t know anything about repairs.......

name: Mitchell West
text: A fellow named Corey Thomas came in and fixed our drier. He identified and fixed the problem quickly and was courteous the entire time he was in my house. Excellent, friendly service. Would happily use this service again.

name: Deb Walton
text: This was the worst customer service ever.  I have a whirlpool refrigerator and the ice dispenser  on the door stopped working.   When I emailed The repair service I told them this first.The repair man they sent did not know how to read his meter because he had it on a.c. not dc current. Then he said I needed a new door completely which would be 474.00. He never ordered the door.  He came back a second time without the door and discovered that there was power in the door, and thought it was the ice maker.  He never ordered that part either.  He told us it would cost over 500.to fix.  It's still not working.  I had no faith that this guy knew what he was doing. HE tried to blame my 75 year old mom for telling him we already replaced the part on our own. Why would I call him if I did that?? Crazy. Then don't get me started on the office staff.  They are rude. Like I asked if I could get my appointment for the morning.   She said I can request it but not guarantee it. I said of course not because we are at your mercy!  If I could give this place a 0 star I would. It sucks DO NOT USE THEM THEY SUCK!

name: Rebekah Weinberger
text: Very helpful and knowledgeable. Were in and out in under 30 minutes!

name: Chelsie Braden
text: This has to be the worst experience I have ever had with a repair company. We bought the extended warranty on our washer and dryer thinking that it was a good idea just in case anything went wrong with them. Well, our washer started giving us a lot of problems and would not stop spinning or drain any water. We called the warranty company and they told us a technician from this company would come out and check our washer. The tech came out and looked at the washer less than 10 minutes and during that time was beyond rude to me. He did not do anything to the washer and just said that he would not be able to come back for another week. He needed to order parts. Well, the day came when someone was supposed to come back to fix our machine and they called us and told us that the repairman called in sick and it would not be til Monday if at all. It is beyond ridiculous what this company has put us through. I would never recommend them to anyone.

name: alex craft
text: Ray did a great, expedient job. Very professional!

name: Howard Dolgoff
text: Axxton is incredible! Fixed my dishwasher flawlessly!

name: James Mulready
text: I bought a new Magtag washer . Found the tub not spinning out water . Lowes sent S&S out to diagnose . Ordered parts, one week later. Part came in they replaced . Machine working like supposed to. Brand new doesnt mean anything . But good service does . S&S did exactly what they said and were very polite.  Hard to find these days . Imagine that someone keeping their promise.  They are great in my eyes

name: Vercingtorix Wilson
text: Knowledgeable staff , prices a little elevated

name: botcwc1
text: Very unorganized. It has been over two months and we still not have not had our appliances fixed. They call and cancel or no-show and then when someone finally shows up has no clue what's going on. Hard to believe that this is the best the Birmingham has to offer I'm sure there are better businesses out there to to send your business too.save the frustration and use a reputable appliance dealer

name: CINDY Sandidge
text: Doug the service technician was a life saver for me. He definitely fixed my washer. I initially had Roberts Appliance sent to my house all they did was clear out some codes and said nothing was wrong. They came back out and have to call technical support amd they were having issues ao the guy left and said he wasnt coming back. But Doug went the extra step and got it fixed for me. I will definitely be recommending this place. Thank you Doug

name: Andrew Kallus
text: Can I give no stars?  Their website says you can schedule a service within two days, it took us weeks before someone was able to come out.  I own a WhirlPool front loading washing machine and the bearing is slowly fading and it makes a lot of noise.  It's loud but it works.  Today, I was told someone will show up between 8am and 12pm.  He did not show up until 2pm.  During the next hour, he disassembled the washing machine.  After about an hour, he told me that headquarters needed him to finish his other jobs, so he left my washing machine disassembled and started his next jobs.  About 530pm he called and said he had one more stop and then will be over.  At 645PM he called again saying he will come back but only to put the washing machine back together.  Around this time I was hungry and went to get food where I noticed he did not turn off the water and it had slowly leaked on the floor.  I cleaned this up and turned off the nozzle.  When he finally returned, he did not clean up any of the water on the floor and started to put the washing machine back together.  Once it was back together, he told me it will work just like it did before where it worked but was noisy.  So once he left, I started a load of wet towels, which I used to clean up the floor.  During the first 30 seconds, while I was gone getting a fan to help dry the floor, I heard what can only be described as a waterfall.  The front of the washing machine was leaking water profusely.  I quickly turned it off. Needless to say that I waited weeks for them to come repair a working washing machine for them to flood my floor and make the washing machine unusable.  Not only that I missed a day of work waiting for 12 hours when if they just did not come it would have been all the same and possibly better.  Throughout this experience, I did not feel like a customer getting any type of good treatment.  He left to do other jobs without even finishing mine and then ends up breaking it.

name: Michelle Fuller
text: Cliff from S&S was very friendly and professional. Highly would recommend.

name: Jameshia Stovall
text:
2/15/2018 they came to my house in Montgomery and when the employee got here. He didn’t even have the part when he got here for my washing machine. Before he left my home he claimed he was going to order the part. And he will return on this Thursday but I was contacted today by the company telling me that the warranty was not approved yet after he had already told me he had ordered the part. Whirlpool needs to revaluate their contract. If my washing machine is not repair by next I will be contacting the attorney Generals office.
AVOID THIS COMPANY AT ALL COST !!! Ridiculous and sad

name: Tim Humphries
text: They’re great with help at the counter, but be warned on the service call!! I had a dryer not heating correctly and while they did fix it, it cost half of what the dryer cost. They will charge a $89 service charge to diagnose the problem. Then you get hit with a $75 labor charge (he was at my house 30-45 minutes) to put a $18 part on. I paid $200 to fix a little bit over $400 dryer. If I’d known ahead of time, I would either called someone else or bought a new one. I should have looked at the reviews first. That should tell you all you need to know.

name: Nina Cobia
text: Wonderful.  The tech had never encountered the problem I was having with the  water dispenser on my refrigerator. He called the factory and the recommended "fix" did not work.  He persevered, called some other techs  and did some trouble shooting until he fixed the problem!  Didn't take long either.  This was after Sears had come out and replaced the water valve which did NOT fix the problem. I called yesterday and he was here today.  It took Sears two weeks.  I would highly recommend. My tech was Doug Raffield and he was professional and friendly.

name: Mal Sinclair
text:
I had an appointment scheduled from 8-12pm today. I called at 12:18 pm to inform them that no one has come by yet. The man that I spoke to told me that the repair man came and waited for ‘15 minutes before leaving a note on my door’. I told him I have not left the house once today, I have been in my living room with my sick toddler. I have a 24 hour Nest video survalliance of my entire street and I can assure you he never even came to my street. He told me I rescheduled your appointment for next week I am sorry we missed you. I said you did not miss me, he is lying to you because I also had a flooring repairman at my house for an hour and a half this morning while my front door was open the entire time and your repairman made no attempt let alone left an alleged note. Instead of trying to resolve the issue he implied I was the liar and not his employee. I would be glad to e mail the video survalliance from 8-12pm!

Update: After filing a BBB complaint I received a reply that the tech did indeed go to the wrong house.

name: D Jackson
text: Doug Raffield came out to service our problem child ice maker!!!! He was great- courteous, prompt, extremely professional, and took great care us. I highly recommend this company and strongly suggest you ask for Doug.

name: Suzanne McCreedy, Esq.
text: Their technician, Randy Wilson, came out to repair a new dryer that I purchased. He was great! Randy immediately knew how to resolve the problem, and took care of it. He was very professional, friendly, and arrived when he said he would.  This was my first time using this company. I will absolutely use these folks again!

name: Asaf Stein
text:
1 star is too much. Unprofessional, disorganized, waste of time and money and patience. DO NOT under any circumstances hire these worthless morons to work on your home.

Like most people here, they came to work on my house through a home warranty. They took months to order parts, 8 or 9 no shows with no calling. Showed up late with out parts.

It’s like I hired the federal government to fix my dishwasher.

Worst experience of my life besides my root canal.

name: Tess Waters
text: They charged me a $95 service fee to come out and "look" at my washer to tell me nothing was wrong with it and said it would be an additional fee to start servicing and find the problem. I called to see what all my warranty covered and the lady I talked with told me that it was only a 5 year when everywhere else was saying 10 year warranty. When I was asking what the fee was for since he didn't do anything. Literally did absolutely nothing. She replied with a smug attitude "You don't think we come out there for free do you?" I asked for a manager and of course one wasnt available and I asked to be called back and that still hasn't happened. Absolute worst customer service I've ever had. DO NOT USE THEM!!

name: Kaitlyn York
text: I wasted $60 on a service call with this company. I explained the door would fall down and  the dishwasher was not cleaning well and the "technician" cycled it and said "everything sounds good" and told me that I was using the wrong kind of detergent and left. He was at my house for a total of 10 minutes.

name: Melissa Freeman
text: Worst company to deal with. Zero customer service. My warranty company requested this company so I'm thinking they are a reputable company.   When I made the appointment, I asked them to call me ahead of time (30 minutes to an hour) to let me know when they were coming out so I could take off work. I said if they could not do this I would take off work as I have been without a washing machine since November and going to the laundry-mat cost me about $50.00 a month. The guy that made the appointment said that would not be a problem for him to call an hour ahead of time. I had to wait two weeks just to get the appointment. I was not happy about having to wait two weeks but no problem, I will do whatever it takes.  They are in Bessemer AL, I am in Pensacola Florida. You would think sometime on the way the technician would have time to make a courtesy call to say "I'm heading your way".  I received a call when the technician was at my home. He didn't leave a message on my voicemail so I'm thinking I just received a call from an unknown caller. He called again so I called him immediately back.  The phone rang once and when straight to a recording that he does not have voicemail set up. I  automatically left work and would be at my home within 10 minutes. So while driving to my home just incase it is the technician.  I call their office. They said he just left my home. I asked if he could go back  I will be there in 10 minutes. They said I need to call my warranty company and reschedule. Then I call the unknown number back and speak to Adam. He said he called me 4 times. I said he called me twice not 4 times and I called him immediately back after the second call.  I asked if he could come back. He said his office is 71 miles away and he was already half way there. Unless this guy is flying this is not possible as all of this took place within a 20 minute time span from my phone records. I will be filing a formal complaint with my warranty company, the better business bureau and the department that issued this company a license.

name: Nicole Thompson
text: My technician has had to come out to my house several times for my oven. He is so sweet everytime! Always calls and lets me know when he is on his way. His name is Tommy Kennedy. Very fast work also!!

name: Henry Wilson
text: My experience with them. I called because an icemaker quit working. The tech came out and turned it on, listened and discovered the compressor wasn't turning on. He never tested the compressor with a meter, never even rolled the machine out from where it was sitting to look at the compressor or any other components. He told me the compressor was bad and it would cost $700 plus to repair it.  I pulled up you tube and watched a few videos on testing compressors, tested it, and it tested fine. I started testing other items until I got to the control board. When i removed it and looked at it, there was an obvious problem where a solder joint had melted away on a relay contact. I tested the relay and it was still working, so i soldered it back, put the machine back together, and it has been cranking out ice ever since. The $85 I paid these people was a complete waste and I am not confident that they know what they are doing.

name: Yvette Kittell
text: Had an appointment scheduled for today, from 8-12. Around 11:30, I called to find out where my tech was and was told by Randy that he was still on job #2. And job #3 still needed attention. I took the day off from work because they told me they would be here between 8-12. Randy made excuses for the tech not showing up on time and didn't offer a solution. Don't call whirlpool and schedule your repairs with them because that's who they will contact. And maybe I got bad service because I live in the South and people in these parts don't like to work and know nothing about customer service.

name: Stephanie Edwards
text: I wish I could leave ZERO stars. This company does NOT care about its customers. S&S came out on a Whirlpool Warranty call (which is probably the reason they didn't care too much to begin with). This was his THIRD time out. I confirmed via email the day before for the 12-5 time slot. He had the address and all codes he needed. He called me at 12:59pm saying if he didn't get a call back within 10 minutes he was moving on. I was in a work meeting. Why don't they call 30 minutes out when they're on the way like other companies? Why did he need me to call him back after I already confirmed I'd be there the day before? Called customer service and they refused to help me, saying I should have just answered the phone. They just wanted to reschedule- for a FOURTH time. Unacceptable.

name: Mary Hendry
text: I have had a HORRIFIC experience trying to get a service from a PAID for extended warranty and I am in coverage. PLEASE be aware that this company treats you like they are doing you a favor or providing services for free that you should be GRATEFUL to even receive.  This is NOT how to treat customers in business.  I had to refuse to allow them to provide service I did pay for due the customer service being intolerable.   The service is NOT free and I am the customer.  Something has been confused with S & S Appliance because they do not agree with this mentality.  I did ask to speak to manger 2 times  and was refused both times, 1st time Buck told he was at lunch and 2nd time Carla, after saying " he does not want to" then stopping herself said  he was in meeting with the owner his father Tim Powers.

name: Mike Quattlebaum
text:
Great customer service spoke with Annette she was very polite and informed.
Answered all my questions quickly and professional

name: Melissa Gullatte
text: We bought a Maytag washer from Lowe's and bought the extra warranty. When our washer broke shortly after, Lowe's set us up with S&S to come fix it. They have been out to look at our washer a total of FOUR times already and have yet to fix the problem. We have been without a washer for six weeks. They seem to be dragging their feet in fixing the problem and are in absolutely no hurry to order the parts. Thankfully this is covered under our warranty through Lowe's because I would be another level of angry if we were having to pay for each service visit. I would avoid this company at all costs.

name: Joseph Ingram
text: The guys were very courteous and professional. Joe took care of our problem and we will definitely be using them again if a need arises! Thanks again!

name: Michael Upton
text: Friendly staff very helpfull

name: Faith Kaiser
text: They are always very late and service men Do not know what they are doing OR MORE THAN LIKELY it is a SCAM they run with Home Warrenty companies. $500 later in service calls, a new motor for a dishwasher that STLL does not get dishes clean. Their solution for $100 service call? Dry Aid! Really?

name: Hayden Lee

name: Daniel Marchand
text:
I wouldn't use this company again. I have a Bosch Dishwasher that had an issue under manufacture warranty and unfortunately the closest authorized Bosch repair vendors was this one (who has an auxiliary service center in Huntsville), and another company in Birmingham (The Birmingham place seemed very nice on the phone, but I didn't want to wait a couple weeks for a tech to fix it... so I called S&S).

First off after calling the other repair place in Birmingham, I found the lady on the phone at S&S very rushy - just wanted name, address, payment method got me off the phone quick... the other repair place took down all my info, make/model, serial #, everything and was going to preorder potential parts so they could do one visit and be done. Dispite my initial impression of calling S&S I went with them anyway since they could come out in 2-3 days vice 1-2 weeks. (when your used to having a dishwasher it's not fun when it's broken...)

So the first guy comes out, looks at the dishwasher, deems we need a new sump pump, leaves. 2nd visit he comes by installs the new part does a really quick test and deems its fixed and leaves.  My wife goes to run the dishwasher on a full cycle and the draining error code comes up again.

I called the company and was informed someone was coming out the next day to check it. This time we get a guy who didn't even know how to spell Bosch (OK I'm exagerating, but in his words he never seen this kind of dishwasher... had no clue how to work it, fix it, nothing...), treated my wife horribley, he had to call Bosch to walk him through troubleshooting, then proceeds to berate my wife saying it's our plumbing get a plumber the dishwasher is fine, and threatens to charge us if we call for warranty purposes again since it is our plumbing.

Just to give this jerk the benefit of the doubt I took apart the piping under my sink and found no blockages (cleaned it a bit anyway), the sink the dishwasher was hooked to for drainage has never had issues... as far as the intall it was professionally installed by Lowe's and has worked flawless for 11 months so how the heck can it be my plumbing?

After fooling with it more myself I found out when the 1st guy replaced our pump it ajared the door that covers the sump pump from the inside of the dishwasher, and some food was caught in there. After I cleaned it and reseated the door correctly it worked fine again...

In summary my experience: Curt, rushy phone operator; experienced, but in a hurry repair tech (1st and 2nd visit same guy); and lastly rude and unknowledgeable repair tech (3rd visit).

Next time if I had to choose between this place and the Birmingham repair place I'll take my chances with how long it takes the Birmingham folks to come out.... I'd rather wait a week longer and have someone take the time to fix it right then some half fast job, but you know it's all about the $$ the more jobs they cram into a day the more $$ they take in so this is what you get.

resp.text: Thank you ma'am. Our customers love that we are quick and efficient.

name: Judy Abel
text: Definitely would recommend Patriot Appliance Repair.  Called in the morning and Kevin had my GE refrigerator repaired the same day.  He will be my to-go guy for any future appliance repairs.  Price was fair and he has a 90 day guarantee.

name: Kyle Slater
text: Kevin was very professional and fixed my oven for a fraction of the price bigger companies wanted just to come out and look. I highly recommend his services.

resp.text: Thank you Man, I hope you are well !

Great service. A+

We us Patriot Appliance Repair for all of our office and property needs. Very polite, effective, and quick. Thank you!!!

text:
Very easy to work with
Professional and  knowledgeable

text: The service provided by Kevin Koontz is prompt and superb!!! I would highly recommend Patriot Appliance repair!!!

name: Michael Boyles
text: Patriot Appliance is tops in service! Kevin always does what he can to get your broken appliances fixed. We call Patriot whenever we have a problem.
