name: Betty Stanford
text: The man that came out was very nice very polite our refrigerator was under warranty and he fixed it right away put the pardon I’ve done business with them before never had a problem keep up the good work

name: Heather Scott
text: whirlpool says they are the only certified repair tech close. But they have been out to my house 12+ times over 2 years and not one thing has actually been fixed.   Parts have been replaced but within a few days there is a new issue. Its been 4 different  appliances. The fridge I have now just needed the ice maker fixed cause it wasn't working the day I got it. Now the fridge won't even cool enough to keep food in it. I just want the things either fixed or for whirlpool to be told they can't be so they will replace it before another warranty runs out and im out alot of money.

resp.text: I’m sorry to hear about the issues you’ve been having. What name might that be under so I can look into it? I don’t have any records under the name Heather Scott.

name: Willa Burton
text: Had to call 2 days in a row.. never showed up after being told they would be here on Thursday. Took off work. Called that evening at 3:30 when no one had came yet or called. No answer. Left a message. It’s 10:45pm and still haven’t gotten a call back.. all I would have needed is a phone call to tell me they were busy and needed to reschedule.. I do not recommend them. Their time is no better than mine.

name: MinerNat108 MinecraftGameGirl108
text: Great people 👏👍

name: Steven Brown
text: They are usually busy, not having many appliance repairmen in the area, so expect a wait. Found my Problem and made temporary repairs within an hour of arriving. Teflon door spacer/riser that keeps door seated in place against the gasket for refrigerator had deteriorated/broken where it looked closed but lost seal and allowed unit to ICE UP. Parts ordered. Very happy with Visit and Repair Cost!!!!

name: DeeAnn Caporale
text: This place is so unprofessional!! Can’t give you a time when they are coming so they say morning. Well morning comes and goes and afternoon I call.... same story oh someone will be there! Total lie! Don’t answer phones don’t show up don’t make appointments for scheduling. Going on for days now! This is the worst place to do business with! Don’t do it!

name: Sharon Guthrie
text: After waiting a couple of days Came out after hours fix my dryer very professional  will use again

resp.text: Hi, I am so sorry for the delay. We have had an influx of service calls lately and unfortunately it’s taking us longer to work through them now because of the extra precautions we are taking due to the virus.

name: Shanquille Finch
text: Needed a refrigerator so found this place on line. When my daughter and I walked in the man was on the phone didn’t give us a hand sign or anything, got up and walked out of the room to the back room. If I could have given no stars I would have. Very, very rude and apparently didn’t need my money. I did look however for a second, priced are SKY HIGH! DO NOT recommend this place to anyone!

resp.text:
I would like to apologize for your experience. That is certainly not typical. We are a local family business and always strive to treat everyone as we would want to be treated. As for the prices, I’ve double checked all the prices we have on refrigerator s and most of them are fairly competitive for the particular models. There was one model that was mis-priced and has been adjusted accordingly and we thank you for bringing that to our attention. Again I’m sorry for what happened in your case and hope you will give us another chance in the future.
Thanks, Josh

name: George Alford
text: Always willing to help with advice.

name: Randall Cowart
text: Sears has great show up time and he was on time. He was polite and explain what my microwave needed for repairs.

name: Christopher North
text: Bought  new refrigerator from sears 4yrs ago. Have had to call for 2 years out and it quit again 2 weeks ago. Still waiting for them to come fix it. Clearly customers are not important to sears anymore. No wonder they are going belly up. They have forgotten who actualy pays thier bills. Not the shareholders....the customer. No customer no business.

name: Earcel Pierce
text: The service was not what l expected it to be because l was charged $179.00 for dryer not being fixed .it was the worse service call l have ever had from you all.

name: marie fischtziur
text: Jolette Fischtziur.  I just had repair for  a small part from my water hose to the connection  for the ice maker in my fridge. It to the repair person about 20 minutes  to  connect it. It cost $489.+  . This is awful. The repair person was kind,polite and professional, but if there is another company available  I will use them. Due to this  lock down I could not find  another company available.  The cost was to high. I tried to speak to someone at the repair center and the women was unwilling to listen to me and hung up. I was not rude.

name: Jennifer Killam
text: They never showed up but said they did, cameras don't lie...but will take your money

name: Ursula Lowe
text: This has nothing to do with the repair man. He was polite and very professional. However, I was appalled having to pay $131.50 for a service that did not require a part. Over the years I have spent so much money on appliances with Sears because I believed in Sears. I am giving it up, I will only buy cheap foreign things at least I don't feel taking advantage when the darn thing brakes down. I'll just get another one. This is were you could have increased business by showing you trust your products and if repairs are required after warranty the costs are reasonable. A $131.50 without parts, in my opinion, is unreasonable. Good luck for the future, without me!

name: Hugh B
text:
Horrible!!!  The first technician showed-up to repair my GAS range with no manometer (device to measure gas pressure), then tried to guess at the problem being related to the electronic ignition system.  Then, the second technician shows-up a week later with the manometer but with no adapters to check the gas line or the regulator pressure so just guesses it's probably the regulator.  But, the regulator he orders and delivered to my house is clearly the wrong part so I have to spend hours with their non-native English speaking customer service representatives to cancel the next service call and get a UPS pickup order to return the part.

Now SEARS is fighting my credit card dispute for all the charges including the wrong part that was returned over a week ago.   No wonder the company is having so much financial difficulty.

I WILL NEVER USE SEARS EVER AGAIN!

name: Mandy Hawsey
text: Was timely and prompt with service, but I will not use them again. Way overpriced for a simple repair. Felt completely ripped off.

name: T Herman
text: I had two services scheduled, Dishwasher and Washer and Dryer.  The first cancelled a week early and was rescheduled (dishwasher). The second after waiting 4 hours, as a no show called on the 5th hour to say they were running late and could they still come (washer & dryer), needless to say the answer was no.   The service provided for the dishwasher was great but the cancels and no shows are unacceptable.  Im not sure if the washer & dryer have been rescheduled, my wife is handling it.

name: Debbie Buford
text: Service was great.  Polite and helpful.

name: Mel Porter
text: Bad serivce

name: Ken McLeod
text: Came on time, was professional

name: Pat Williamson
text: My service was done by repair contract with sears.  At the time of repair approximately 2 weeks ago a part was replaced for the 3rd time that controls the starting up--running on.  NOW AS OF LAST NIGHT DISHWASHER WILL NOT START AGAIN--THE 4TH TIME.  IT HAS BLINKING LIGHTS AND THAT IS ALL.  I AM DISGUSTED!!!!

name: Paul Smith
text: Perfect in all aspects

name: Jim Van Matre
text: Excellent in EVERY WAY

name: Beverly McLeod
text: Did not fix problem. Charged to much!!!!!!!!!!!  Said they fixed it but didn't!

name: Margaret Middleton
text: Excellent...

name: Wil Cushman
text: Aaron was our technician and he was very nice and professional. He got the work done very quickly. The response time and communication was very good. Our repair was a little more expensive than expected, but once the job was done Aaron notified me that the price had dropped once they got my part in stock.  Very happy all around!

name: Renee Hamilton
text: Josh was on time and professional.  He answered all my questions and walked me through the repair process.  I would definitely recommend him.

name: William Heard
text: Our tech Tanner came to our house twice. He arrived on time, was very friendly and went to work immediately. He determined the problem with our ice maker within 10 minutes. Had to order the part. Came back 2 days later. Again was friendly and replaced the part. All told his total time at our house was less than 30 minutes. We would recommend this company to our friends. They did a great job communicating by text by email and by phone. We will ask them again if we have a problem.

name: Jessica Bowers
text: Carter was the best!! Super helpful. Came out and had our dishwasher fixed in less than 15 minutes. He also gave us a whole bunch of preventative tips to keep it from happening again. We will definitely be using Mr. Appliance in the future.

name: Lizzy Dee
text: I’ve used this company multiple times for different things. Yes, they are more expensive than some other repair service companies, but they also do a much better job. Scheduling service is easy and most of the time an appointment can be made  within a reasonable time frame. The technicians show up on time, do their job and are respectful of your property. I definitely recommend.

name: Kathi Waters
text: Excellent and prompt service.  Extensive repair of refrigerator completed on time.  Technician extremely courteous and helpful.

name: Jan Deuel
text: After several days of getting the run-around from our former appliance guy, I finally called to ask if Houston Piatt (son of my friend) could come check out our broken washing machine.  He came within a few hours of my phone call and got us fixed up very quickly!

name: Mary Montgomery
text: At my home in less than 2 hours of calling.  Quickly assessed issue and estimated job which turned out to be very accurate.  Had the parts on the truck.  Friendly office staff and technician, great communication.  Would highly recommend.

name: Pool Escapes
text: I highly recommend mr appliances. I can count on 1 hand how many times I’ve been truly impressed by the work I’ve hired someone to do. Josh was very informative and helpful with everything I had a problems with! I will never call anyone else in the future. This is how business should be done (coming from a business owner) and I highly appreciate it!

name: Mary Montgomery
text: At my home in less than 2 hours of calling.  Quickly assessed issue and estimated job which turned out to be very accurate.  Had the parts on the truck.  Friendly office staff and technician, great communication.  Would highly recommend.

name: John McCurdy
text: Houston did an excellent job. He was very friendly and professional. He explained everything and showed us the defective part that needed to be replaced.

name: Austin Carter
text:
Very professional people. Very friendly and get the job done. Have used them for any needs I have regarding the appliances in our home.

We had Carter as our technician for our most recent problem, and he did an outstanding job and was an extremely pleasant technician to work with. Carter was very easy to engage with, went beyond what was needed, and kept his cool even though the job we required was probably frustrating to deal with. I called back to the business to let them know how great of a job he did, and i hope it gets passed on to him or that he sees this review. We will definitely request him from now on. If the manager or owner sees this, please let Carter know we reached out to you guys to let you know what a fantastic job he did. Thanks again!

name: Greg B
text: I can’t complain about anything but the price. Approximately $275 in labor to replace a pump that took 30 minutes is a bit much.  The year warranty on the part is nice to have.

name: Second Chapter Divorce Recovery
text: Houston was fabulous! Very professional! Very knowledgeable! I will request Houston next time!

name: Larry Falkner
text: The guy wore a mask. He was polite, did not make a mess at all. He made sure i was very pleased, and explained my warranty on the parts & labor. I highly trusted the work he performed! Thanks Again!

name: Hayley Haren
text: I used Mr. Appliance Over the Mountain to fix my stove. They were very quick to contact me and set up an appointment time. Service was on time and prompt. Very satisfied and would recommend and use services again.

name: Brianna Henry
text: Colby came in the time window they told me. He worked quickly and efficiently. I'm glad that the part he replaced is under their warranty for a year. I'm satisfied with the service and would definitely use them again if I need an appliance repaired.

name: Sam Kemp
text: Josh was extremely knowledgeable  and professional. We appreciate his ability to solve our refrigerator issue. Josh is a good man.

name: Nate Lawson
text: Hello.  I used Mr Appliance to repair a microwave.  I first had them come look at the microwave a year ago.  A technician came to the house, looked at the microwave for about 5 minutes, didn't touch a thing and said it was the controller that was broken.  He charged his $100 service charge and only after I called would he send me a quote with the part I was supposed to get and the over $600 quote.  I didn't trust him so I never went through with the repair.  After a year of a non-functional microwave, I called again and had a different technician come out.  This guy was way better and actually diagnosed the problem and said it was a completely different part.  same $600.  So this time I had them come fix it.  but when he came out to replace the part (which I later found out could be ordered on the internet for less than $200 and takes all of 5 screws to replace), the part he ordered wasn't functional.  so he frankensteined together part of my old microwave and part of his new part to get it to work.  i guess it works, but when you pay $700 to fix a microwave, I would have liked to get a brand new part.  i tried to call the company to tell them what happened and they did the typical "someone will call you back".  which they never did. i only write this now, because I have since had service by an excellent appliance company called "Appliance Connection". Way better in every single way.

name: Lydia Kirkland
text: I highly recommend Mr. Appliance! They always called when the technician was on the way, Larry was very polite and knowledgeable, and of course our dryer now works!

name: James Hall
text: The technician was very professional and polite.  The reason for low rating was I put in my comment that I was having no gas flow to my cooktop.  They came out looked and said you have to call the gas company to fix gas appliances.  For $99 service call to inform me to call someone else is unacceptable, especially  when they were informed  of the issue.  Why advertise you repair gas appliances and then you can't / don't?  I would not recommend them for anything related to gas appliances.

resp.text:
Hello,
I apologize you had a bad experience with our company. We do work on gas appliances however if the appliance has no gas coming into the appliance we recommend a plumber.

name: Samantha Jamison
text: Great customer service! On time! Actually, the second time I used them, they had a cancellation and called to ask me if I would like the repairman to come early, which I gratefully accepted. They come in, diagnose the problem, fix it, and they're gone. Very efficient and friendly.

name: Julie Gayle
text: Larry was my technician. He was on time and repaired my dryer in record time. I was very pleased with his work.

name: Chris Harlow
text: Tanner arrived on time   Went right to work identified and repaired faulty valve. Great service. Second time we used them They are my go to appliance shop

name: Kathy Harrell
text: The service man, Josh, was great.  He had the parts and fixed my subzero in a quick manner.  He was professional and yet friendly.   He is an asset to his company.

name: Grace Butler
text: The very nice and thoughtful young man was here on time and finished the work quickly.   He was polite and offered useful suggestions.  I will call them the next time I need work done.

name: xprezeu
text: It was professional and on time but expensive. To fix a igniter in the oven was $400. It’s an old 20 year old range. I’ll just get a new one. Same for the washer but I needed to wash this week. I could have bought a new one for that also.  I’ll recommend but with the caveat it’s too expensive.

name: Ashleigh Wise
text: Troy was very king, professional, and polite! Our washer was up and working in less than 30 minutes. He was on time and worked quickly and efficiently!  10/10

name: Jeff Myers
text: Very pleased with the overall experience. The technician was courteous and knew exactly what the issue was and had it fixed in a timely manner.

name: Carrie Ingram
text: Chase was on time , very courteous and took care of the issue quickly.

name: Peggy Saunier
text:
Our tech Tanner was super.  Answered questions,
Super pleasant.

name: Robert Blake
text:
Very professional.  Houston found problem quickly and repair done.
Very pleased.  Neighbors also use your company 😁

name: Debra Baxter Cooper
text: Colby and Tanner did an incredible job.  Came early, found the problem, ordered the part and came back the same day and fixed my dryer.  I couldn't be happier!  Thanks so much!  I highly recommend!

name: Erin Whaley
text: The call center people were personable, professional. The repair technician, Chase, did an excellent job. They were able to come repair my refrigerator days before other companies.

name: Russell Lewis
text: Charged $382 to replace a $25 heating element a 5 minute job. I could have bought a brand new dryer for that price. My wife was home by herself and I feel they took advantage.

name: Lita Stephens
text: The refrigerator is working beautiful, like it is new. Chase  was nice and professional; came to my place time and a wonderful job. I will recommend Them.

name: Carole Chomicz
text: Mr. Appliance showed up on time and called first to let us know when the repairman was on the way. He was so respectful, and COVID cautious too. He placed a mat outside and placed his shoes there and put on protective slip-ons and wore a well-fitting mask. He thoroughly evaluated and  promptly diagnosed the problem with our oven and gave us the repair estimate with a full explanation. We authorized the repair and he ordered the needed part(s) on the spot. He returned in just a couple days with the needed parts and fixed our oven perfectly. Mr. Appliance also warranties their repairs, including parts and labor. The repairman, Troy Hill, was so kind, professional, and explained everything thoroughly. I would definitely call them again should I ever have another need for an appliance repair. I recommend them highly!

name: kendall smith
text: I was extremely pleased with the knowledge of the service technician, Houston Piatt. Exactly on time and ended up correcting two problems with my fridge instead of just the one. Very reasonable prices. Will definitely recommend them to anyone.

name: Robert Abrams
text: Jordan was very professional and knowledgeable about the washer got the part put it on  tested it out and cleaned up his mess. Thanks Mr Appliance 👍

name: Melinda D
text: Colby replaced a compressor in our refrigerator. He was timely, friendly, professional, and completed the job as promised.  We will be calling Mr. Appliance again and will recommend them to our friends.

name: Sheila McKenna
text: My technician was Josh and he was excellent. Very knowledgeable and very friendly. He was on time and efficient and getting my oven repair. I would highly recommend Mr. appliance and Josh!

name: Joanie Ingram
text: The service representative was immaculate- knew what to order / Repaired my refrigerator Left my kitchen clean/ showed & explained the parts for my fridge. Highly recommend this company.

name: Susan Birket
text: Mr Appliance repaired my dryer quickly and professionally - I was able to schedule service online, which was great, and then they sent me a text notification of my technician. They also sent an email when he was on route. The technician did a great job and finished quickly. Definitely will use them if I need another appliance repaired!

name: Ramona Graffeo
text: Excellent customer service, guy was courteous, on time, wore a mask, and was extremely knowledgeable.  Very happy and encouraged my neighbor to call Mr. Appliance.  She did and she was also v happy with the work they did.

name: Bama Patriot205
text: Larry did a great job, he was very fast and professional.

name: Denise Zekoff
text: Called Christmas Eve because refrigerator was leaking water and was damaging the floor.  Technician Chase was here within 2 hours. Very polite and practicing COVID protocol. Knew exactly what was wrong and repaired quickly showing my husband step by step what he was doing. Didn't try to selll us parts we didn't need. Very thankful for Chase and this company

name: Betty Monroe
text:
The Service Professional, Mr. Jordan McDade,
replaced a drainer pump in my dishwasher.
He vacuumed the washer from water, vacuumed the hoses, and all around under the washer.
He was very particular in his work.
I appreciated his skill, kindness, and promptness in arriving. Thank you so much.
Betty Monroe

name: Jennifer Brewington
text: Excellent service all the way from first call to completion! Josh did a great job, quickly diagnosing the problem and explaining as he went along...even had needed part in truck! Will definitely call again with any appliance issues!

name: Jeremy Johnston
text: I scheduled a service w/Mr. Appliance based on the high ratings they have on Google Reviews.  I'm happy to report that i too had a terrific experience.  I had a freezer icing up and my repairman Chase diagnosed and fixed the issue of a bad seal in 20 minutes.  He was careful not to get water everywhere while doing the repair by putting down towels.  He put everything back as it was before he arrived.  He wore shoe protectors to not track anything in the house, and when he had to run out to his truck for a tool, he first removed those protectors and left them outside the front door so as not to get them overly dirty when he was outside.  That kind of attention to detail told me he was a professional and conscientious worker, and that Mr. Appliance trains their team to do even the little things like that right.    I'm a first-time customer and they'll be my first call next time I need appliance service.

name: Lora Smith
text: Only reason I hesitate to give 5 stars is because I was charged for a 2 hour labor for a job that took about 30 minutes maybe. Otherwise everything was very smooth and the staff and technician were professional and courteous.

name: Skipper Kitchens
text: Ben repaired our oven quickly and was professional and considerate .

name: Chris Pearce
text: Great communication with this company. They contacted me to confirm appointments and when my part was ordered and expected to arrive. They also called when the technician was on the way with an ETA. Josh was friendly and professional. He was concerned and careful with my hardwood floors, as he had to move the fridge. The price was a little higher than I expected, but with the great service, I wouldn't complain.

name: Pamela Presley
text: Ben was on time the first visit and again when he returned the next day with the oven part. Great service. I’ll definitely use them again.

name: Richie Bruce
text: Our dishwasher was leaking but not sure of the source.  I called Mr. Appliance at the number listed in Google, and spoke to a friendly, real person!  We were able to schedule an appointment for the next morning.  The repairman, Houston, arrived ahead of schedule with a call ahead from the dispatcher letting me know he was on the way.  Houston wore a mask (COVID-19 safety precaution) as well as protective booties over his work boots.  He was very courteous, professional, and knowledgeable.  He quickly diagnosed the problem, provided a quote to repair on the spot, and upon my approval, began his work immediately, by going to get the parts and returning quickly.  The job was completed in a timely manner with care and attention to detail, at a very fair price.  I highly recommend Mr. Appliance Over the Mountain to anyone with appliance repair needs.

name: Beth Vickery
text: Mr. Appliance was wonderful. They had an appointment available soon when we needed them. Aaron was right on time, knew exactly what the problem was, had the part with him, and fixed it quickly! He was also very professional and friendly. We would definitely use Mr. Appliance again!

name: Lori Jacobson
text:
Troy did a great job fixing our dishwasher.
On time and knowledgeable about problem with dishwasher. Ordered parts and was fixed in 2 days!!

name: Thomas Hall
text: Very professional and polite. Very reasonable rates

name: KELLYE NARO
text: Aaron was polite and professional. Service repair was quick even with having to order a part. I would highly recommend using them and will call with any future repairs that may be needed.

name: Brent Fuhrman
text: Very quick and professional. Can’t say it was a great value, but it had to be done quickly and accurately. Can’t argue with the results. Just wish I’d paid a little less.

name: Josh Britnell
text: Solid on communication and showed up on time.  We were treated kindly and are thankful for a working refrigerator!

name: Marge Cianchetti
text: Mr Appliance did a great job with our fridg repair. They called to confirm appt the day before and actually came an hour or so earlier than they were scheduled the day of appt( but they did call and ask first!!) the repair guy did a super job in getting us fixed quickly and professionally. Thanks for being so punctual and getting our fridg back to working order !!

name: Myra Crawford
text: My 50+ year old Maytag washing machine had its first ever need for service. The motor gave out. Mr. Appliance came quickly, pronounced it should be fixed because it was a simple repair and "they dont make washing machines like that anymore." The technician found parts locally and repaired it within an hour the next day. She's a bit banged up for an old gal, but she's ready to go for another 50.

name: Matt Ford
text: Repaired my dishwasher. Great management that truly cares about the customer!! Strongly recommend!

name: melody franks
text: The repairman was very knowledgeable about our specific problem. He stayed, I feel maybe a little longer with us, to assure the problem had been rectified (and it was). He was very courteous, nice and treated us like friends.

name: Sandye Nance
text: He was able to quickly diagnose my problem. And I was definitely surprised that he knew so much about under counter ice makers. He even took the time to educate me on how to keep it clean. Very good service and I definitely will use again.

name: Shelby Riddle
text: I am pleased with the service and how seriously they are taking covid right now. Thank you for getting me back up and running!

name: John McNamara
text: Made my appointment on line. Great customer service notifications before the job. Very cordial and professional servicemen. The photo identification of the repair specialists beforehand was most professional. The men wore protective face masks and boot covers before entering our home. 👍

name: Forlorn Sweet
text: Excellent serviceman Aaron. We were able to get an appointment quickly. While we don't look forward to more appliance repairs LOL, we do look forward to using Mr Appliance again.

name: Anthony Blackburn
text: Technician came earlier than expected(that was a plus). He diagnosed the problem in a timely fashion and was very knowledgeable in his diagnostic. He was very professional and did a great job on the repair of my refrigerator. I would highly recommend Mr. Appliance again.

name: Alex Weldon
text: Troy was a fantastic technician. Super helpful, super friendly and super knowledgeable. He quickly diagnosed the problem, had the parts with him and mended the issue quickly all while holding genuine conversation. The call center was also very helpful, patient, and friendly. Overall a great experience. Will be using Mr. Appliance for any future repairs for sure

name: Landon Bentley
text:
I have used Mr Appliance on two occasions. Once for an overflowing dishwasher and most recently for a freezer that wasn’t freezing. Communication was outstanding. On both occasions I received  phone calls and emails prior to the appointment to let me know when the technician was on his way and the email included a picture of the tech. They also followed up afterward.  On both occasions, my technician was Carter. He was courteous, professional and very knowledgeable. He quickly diagnosed the problem both times and made repairs in the best and most economical way.
I can’t say enough good things about Mr Appliance and about Carter! I highly recommend  them!

name: Holly A.
text: Our technician was very knowledgeable and professional. He explained the issue and was able to order the necessary parts and fix our refrigerator within a short period of time. We will definitely recommend Mr. Appliance to our friends and family.

name: Jane Gibbons
text: Houston Piatt with Mr. Appliance was great He repaired two of the stove eyes on my oven He came and assessed the problem ordered the parts and came back once the parts arrived This young man Houston represents his company well I will request Houston when I need any appliance repair Thank you Houston

name: Ken Atkinson
text: Communication was great on when technician was coming. He came and showed me the problem and fixed it right away. Great service!

name: Claudia Herring
text: Ben worked quickly and repaired our dishwasher’s electrical wiring issue for a fair price.

name: Tim Yongue
text: Did not take long to schedule an appointment.  Larry, the Service Professional was extremely knowledgeable about my appliance, was professional, very sincere, and I loved that he used extra precautions with the COVID pandemic before entering my home.

text: I cannot say enough good about our experience with Mr Appliance!  First of all, Houston was the guy who came out:  punctual, very polite, extremely knowledgable, extremely courteous. name: Charles Woodall
text: Mr. Appliance came out to repair my 2 year old dishwasher. Diagnostic charge was $99, refundable if they do repairs. Cost of ordering and replacing control board was $375, with half down. Came back out and installed board.  Still didn’t work, must need another part for another $391!  I was very upset about mounting costs exceeding cost of new dishwasher. Repairman was very understanding and said he would request office to refund back down to $99 diagnostic charge, which they did in a few days. Ordered a new dishwasher and dishes are clean again!  Thanks to management for reasonable refund policy!  Will use them again!

name: Billie Lopez

Sunday before thanksgiving the clock panel went out on my stove. When I called On Monday the young lady on the phone was so helpful and courteous.  She scheduled a tech first thing Tuesday morning.   The tech arrived on time and checked on parts my stove needed. Unfortunately parts could not be replaced. The tech was very professional and helpful. He did show me how to control the temperature.

The only problem I had was with  a company policy that charges a service fee of $99. I could understand that amount if the tech had to  return to bring parts back. In my case he would not be returning to replace parts. I felt the charge was high.

name: Dorann Tanner
text: Read through reviews before you call! I wish I had! Common theme- OVERPRICED! Quoted me over $450 to repair heating element in dryer. Tech said it was because the part cost over $300. I thought that was too high so I paid diagnostic fee of $99 and decided to call around. 1st company I called said “No way, that’s outrageous”- looked up my dryer and said $263 for service, repair, and part. Part is less than $175. I called back to see if they could match and they said my dryer is harder to work on than other dryers so that’s why it is more. Do not use. Call around!

resp.text: I’m sorry to hear you think our services are overpriced. In looking at this Work Order, we actually quoted the entire heating element assembly, which is a more reliable repair than just replacing the actual element within the assembly. We also use OEM parts straight from the manufacturer, so you know you aren’t getting a cheaper knockoff part. On top of that, we include a 1- year parts and labor warranty on our work. Our competitors only offer warranties anywhere between 30-90 days, max. Therefore if that assembly were to fail in 10 months, we would cover that completely, whereas the company that quoted you $263, likely would not. I hope this clears up some questions you may have about our business. Thanks for the feedback.

name: Jasper Odell
text: Price gougers. I was charged $191 for a 10 minute job that involved melting the ice in my refrigerator drain. I wasn't even given a quote before they started work, otherwise I would have said NO to this insane pricing. The receipt itself doesn't even give me a breakdown of the price, only $191 for minor cosmetic repair. This is my 2nd time hiring this company and they were able to quote me before starting work on the first job. The second job was absurdly priced and they got away with it due to their high service fee and no quote upfront. Their $79 'diagnostic fee' and dodgy work authorization are major red flags to be avoided. There are numerous other 1 star reviews complaining about their price gouging on unsuspecting customers, I should have read all of the reviews before hiring and not just looked at the 5 star rating. I called the supervisor (Derek) to let him know that I was overcharged and never received a quote before the work started. He said he would return my call and never returned my call about the issue -- unprofessional all the way through.

resp.text: Jasper, I apologize you feel this way. It is our policy to provide quote before work is done, so I will certainly look into this and address it to the technician to avoid it in the future. If you look at other service fees in this field by other service companies, I think you will find our diagnostic fee is very comparable and reasonable.

text: I'm all about good, quality customer service and this company has it. Not only did I get a call to confirm my appointment but I also received a text when the technician was 30 minutes away. The issue was diagnosed and the cost was a little higher than expected but I figured that's the case with LG washers. Afterwards, "Larry" explained how we should maintain upkeep to prevent future issue. He was in and out in 1 hour. That was a month ago and so far all is well with my washer. I give Mr. Appliance 4.5 stars and would recommend to friends and family.

name: Brandon Powell
text:
I had already taken apart my dishwasher to try and diagnose myself. In the process of taking apart the machine I realized the rubber gaskets on some parts were stretched out and I needed new parts so I called in Mr. Appliance to finish the job. Initially they wanted to replace the gaskets AND a pump which was working fine, so I told the tech just to do the gaskets which cut the cost in half. For gaskets that I later found online for roughly $20/per (I needed 2), they charged me $205 for parts and labor. I guess that's the cost of having someone else do the job!

The dishwasher now works fine again, but the technician did not screw my dishwasher back into the cabinetry correctly, so the door doesn't shut as sturdily as it did before. I plan on calling Mr. Appliance in the next few days to ask them to come out and correct this since it was part of the job.
**I ended up calling Mr. Appliance to tell them about the dishwasher not being installed correctly, and I asked for a different technician. They sent someone out who was more professional and he cleaned up the job to my satisfaction at no charge.

text: I recently used MA for a stove repair. As with a previous dryer repair, they arrived on time, very professional looking, quoted and repaired my issue with no hassle. I have referred them to several friends. I will use them again and again! Great company and well done job!

name: Amanda Moulin
text: I normally do not write reviews, but I have to share my experience. I called on last Friday to see if/when they had availability to come look at my dryer. The office staff seemed nice, scheduled me the same day, $79.00 diagnostic fee which would be waived if we do the service needed with them. I told the woman scheduling the service that my dryer was giving us the "FE" error code, which when I googled it meant it needed a new electronic control board or it could be the fuse which is often mistaken as the electronic board error, both being "FE". She assured me that their technician would do a thorough diagnostic check to ensure they ordered the right parts, etc... The technician arrived 20 minutes outside of the 1-3 window, which I was fine with considering it was same day service. He went into the laundry room, pushed some buttons on the dryer, got on his tablet, searched the error code "FE", then 5 minutes later told me I needed a new electronic control board and with parts/labor it would be $384.00, jaw dropped. I asked how he knew what was wrong because he had not taken one part off, did not check the electronic board or the fuse, he then raised his voice telling me that there was nothing to check, it was the electronic board, gesturing to the error code. The tech seemed very agitated with me and I explained I was not questioning how he does his job, rather asking how he knew what was wrong because he only googled exactly what I did which said it could be either the board or fuse. At this point my brother who was visiting came to the laundry room after he heard him raising his voice and asked him about the fuse as well and got the same response. The tech then asked if we wanted to proceed with the parts ordered, which I replied no and he said ok it will be $79.00, he spent 10 minutes total in my house including talking to me and did not do a thorough diagnostic check. After he left, my brother who actually works on computers, ordered a new electronic board from Amazon for $36.00, it arrived, he changed it out after watching a YouTube video and shock shock it did not work. He then took the entire dryer apart to get to the fuse (which is why I think the tech did not want to spend time doing it on a Friday), tested the fuse which showed the fuse was out, ordered a new fuse from Amazon for $7.00, arrived today, put it in the dryer with the old electronic board, and magic, it works! Now we are sending back the electronic board to Amazon we ordered since it was not the electronic board and we spent $7.00 vs $384.00 on this repair. Very disappointed that I spent $79.00 for a tech to shout at me and not do any actual checks or work.

text: Price gougers. I was charged $191 for a 10 minute job that involved melting the ice in my refrigerator drain. This is my 2nd time hiring this company and they were able to quote me before starting work on the first job. The second job was absurdly priced and they got away with it due to their high service fee and no quote upfront. Their $79 'diagnostic fee' and dodgy work authorization are major red flags to be avoided. There are numerous other 1 star reviews complaining about their price gouging on unsuspecting customers, I should have read all of the reviews before hiring and not just looked at the 5 star rating. I called the supervisor (Derek) to let him know that I was overcharged and never received a quote before the work started. He said he would return my call and never returned my call about the issue -- unprofessional all the way through.

resp.text: Jasper, I apologize you feel this way. It is our policy to provide quote before work is done, so I will certainly look into this and address it to the technician to avoid it in the future. If you look at other service fees in this field by other service companies, I think you will find our diagnostic fee is very comparable and reasonable.

name: Amanda C
text: Amazing 5 Star, white glove service! Witten(service tech) was the most personable, professional, knowledgeable technician I have ever worked with! He arrived to my parents door less than 2 hours after contacting Mr. Appliance when another company could not make the appointment that had been set up a week in advance! Most repairs are same day or next day. No charge for service call.  Repair quote was given before repair. Competitive, reasonable pricing. He was able to diagnose and fix the repair in less than 15 minutes! Called Mr. Appliance at 8:30am and my parent's Kennmore icemaker was working by 10:45am. One year warranty on labor and parts. They stand behind their work. Very impressed! I will be calling Mr. Appliance Over the Mountain for all of my family's future appliance repair needs. You will not be disappointed! I did not receive any compensation or discount for my review. Honest, dependable company that cares about their customers and the service they provide. Thank you Witten and Mr. Appliance for taking such great care of our appliance repair needs! -Tim & Nancy Layfield from Pinson, Alabama
